loans.use: to purchase bananas for sale to clients in the market and meet her family needs and those of her clients.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 51 years old, married to John and supports a family of five children. 

She has been practicing this farm produce business  for the last 17 years earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Alice has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm produce for sale in the market for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm produce for sale in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is 32 years old, married and supports a family of three children. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last seven years earning KES 8,000 per month.
 
Jared has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm tools and inputs for use in the farm for higher production and supply for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to start dairy farming in the area. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs for use in the farm for higher production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana is 37 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. She is working hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She, with her husband (also shown in the photo), is doing agricultural work for some years. They crop different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds along with good quality soil and mud, currently Farzana has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with good quality soil and mud.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land in order to expand his farming activity as well as earn additional income.

loans.name: Shokran

texts.en: Shokran is a 28 year old married woman and a mother of one child. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate an extra amount of income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as a digging hoe 'jembe' and fertilizer to improve his produce for a better harvest.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis es una persona muy buena y responsable. Actualmente está trabajando en una empresa donde se desempeña como vendedor, de esa forma lucha por poder estudiar. 
Él está siguiendo la carrera de Contabilidad ya que uno de sus objetivos es llegar a ser un profesional para así llegar a su meta que es llegar a tener un  ingreso más elevado y seguro para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Luis is a very good and responsible person. Currently, he is working in a company where he works as a salesman, and so he strives to be able to study.

He is continuing with the accounting major since one of his objectives is to become a professional to thus reach his goal, which is to have a higher and secure income to help his family.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his program’s fees and so be able to continue with his studies as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en: Najma is a 40-year-old married woman. She is a very talented lady and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Some years ago she started her business of tailoring to run her household activities. At this time she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has now requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching more dresses on time. This will give her a boost in her earnings, which she wishes to spend on providing a quality life to her family members. She is shown in the photo along with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching more dresses

loans.name: Fareeda

texts.en:
Fareeda is a 32 year old, divorced woman. She has been in the business of animal purchases and sales for many years. She wants to contribute to the family income as she is living with her parents.

Fareeda is motivated to expand her business for a prosperous future. She has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers.

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria está estudiando la carrera de enfermería para poder salir adelante y mantener a su familia por medio de sus ingresos.
Ella está contenta ya que a través de sus conocimientos podrá ayudar a otras personas.
Pide este préstamo para el pago de las cuotas de su carrera para poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en: Maria is studying Nursing so that she can get ahead and support her family from her income. She is happy as through her knowledge she can help other people. She is requesting this loan to pay tuition for her courses so she can continue to study.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, para poder ser un buen profesional  por medio de sus conocimientos poder abrirse camino para poder ser útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su universidad para poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por sus anhelos.
texts.en: Cesar is from the city of Curuguaty. He is studying Accounting in order to become a good professional. With his knowledge he wants to open a path to being someone useful, not only for himself but for others too. He is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the payment of his university tuition to continue to study and fight for what he desires.

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 30 years old, married to Gilbert, and supports a family of two children. 

She has been practicing farm supplies in the area for the last seven years, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Sabina has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk to earn more income

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is aged 40 and married with four children, of whom only two attend school. He operates a depot mainly selling beers and sodas, alongside farming mainly growing cassava and beans. He dreams of expanding his business as well as educating his children. He will use the loan to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy more beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en: Ghada is a 51-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and four children, three of whom are still attending school. Her husband is the main income source in the family in order to enhance their way of living. He has been working in selling clothes for the past 27 years. Ghada hopes to help her children with their education. For that reason, she wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner vitas s.a.l to pay the first installment of the study fees.  She will be more than happy to see them graduating and achieving their master’s degree. In the future, she plans to take new Kiva loans and keep on covering their study fees.

loans.use: to pay the first installment of her children's study fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seedlings for planting to be supplied to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair and maintain his taxi for a better business.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is 32 years old, married to Philip, and supports two children. 

She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last eight years, earning KES 10,000 per month.
 
Janes has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the area to earn more income. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the area to earn more income

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida  is a married woman and the mother of three children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing it for many years. She knows the techniques of stitching very well. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc. to sew more dresses on time.

loans.name: Ismak's Group

texts.en:
Ismak is a rural villager living in Kratie province. She is a 30-year-old mother of three children who are too young to attend school. Nowadays, she grows cassava on three hectares farmland and works on another farm for a fee. She has been involved in this business for eight years and it earns her about 63,000 KHR per day. 

Ismak has been an existing client of VisionFund for one cycle already and completely paid back the loan. The previous loan helped her to stabilize her current business. Due to lack of funds to do farming again for this season, she is now leading a group to apply for a new loan via VisionFund. As a group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy pesticides for her farming. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and give her the ability to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farming

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es:
El señor. Ignacio está cursando el último  año de la carrera de Análisis de Sistema, quiere poder aplicar todo lo que aprendió a una empresa grande y reconocida.
Comenta que su carrera nunca fue muy fácil, pero que siempre ha puesto todo de si para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su titulación, ya que es bastante costoso y el ya lo tiene que cubrir.
texts.en:
Ignacio is in his last year of studies for a degree as a systems analyst. He wants to be able to use everything he has learned working for a large and well-known firm. 

He says that his studies have not been easy, but he has given his all to them in order to be someone in life. 

He is seeking the loan to be able to cover the costs for his degree, since it is very expensive and he needs to be able to cover them.

loans.use: to cover the costs of getting his degree.

loans.name: Koser

texts.en: Koser is a 49-year-old married woman. She is the mother of five children. Her husband has been doing a business of animal sales and purchase for many years. Koser fully supports and assists her husband with his work. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell in the market.

loans.name: Krimas' Group

texts.en: Krimas is a 37-year-old mother of four children, three of whom are in school while the other one is too young to attend school. She is a rural villager living in Kratie province. Nowadays, her family’s living is dependent on rice farming on two hectares of farmland and working as a paid worker is an additional source of her family’s income. She has been involved in this business for four years and it earns her about 91,600 KHR per day. Due to the previous year when her cassava grew not well, it provided her a lower income than usual and caused her to have a lack of funds to do farming for this season. Because of this, she is now leading a small group to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund to buy pesticide for cassava growing. She hopes to earn more income and be able to buy more farmland to expand her farming area.

loans.use: to buy pesticide for cassava growing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizers to improve his productivity.

loans.name: Kutlwano Community Group

texts.en:
Mpho (36), Audrey (28) and Topsy (39) are ambitious, hardworking women who decided to start a business together and generate revenue to feed their families. The trio are contracted by households to clean garbage bins after waste has been disposed. 

"This is a huge market for us. We realized that when trash is taken by the council, the bins are left dirty and smelly which is uncomfortable for many people so we decided to clean the bins," says Mpho, the current group chairperson.

This idea has proved profitable for the ladies and the demand is rising on a daily basis. 

"People feel nice when the garbage is gone and their bins are clean. The air is fresh," says Topsy. 

They are requesting a mobile compressor that will pump more water and help them clean better and more efficiently. The compressor will help the ladies move from house to house, thus save time and space and help them meet demand.

loans.use: to buy a mobile compressor

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 65-year-old, hardworking, married man with three children, aged 27, 25 and 20 years old, living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  

He practices the rearing of cattle alongside farming where he gets his extra income. With this, he has been able to sustain his family. 

He hopes to expand his cattle farm and also reinvest; however, he is limited by foot and mouth diseases that attack his cattle, and prolonged drought.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labour for harvesting his cotton.

loans.name: Race Course Traders Group

texts.en:
Fatmata is a member of Race course trader solidarity group. She sells scrap metals. Fatmata has been selling scrap metal for the past nine years. She uses proceeds of her business to pay for her children’s education and to provide livelihood for hers family.

Fatmata and other group members of Race course trader are requesting for their first loan. Fatmata and her group members are in need of a loan of 4,000,000SLL. See Fatmata (is on the right of the group picture). Of this amount, Fatmata will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more different types of scrap metal for her business. 

Fatmata is forty years old, married with two children.  She hopes that her business will continue to exist so that she can save enough money to educate her children and also prepare for her old age. Fatmata hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family.

Fatmata and her group members thank you for financing their business

loans.use: to purchase more different types of scrap metal for her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 33, is a hardworking lady in Hoima, Uganda. A government worker, she used a little savings to open a veterinary drug shop to earn extra income to improve her total welfare, only to be affected by the high license fees levied on her business. 

Josephine is requesting a loan to buy veterinary drugs to sell. Her dream is to build a permanent house.

loans.use: to buy veterinary drugs to sell.

loans.name: Soknim

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kratie province’s Prey Prosorb district, Soknim is 34 years old and a mother of two children. For her living, she has sold grocery items and clothes for 16 years. Her daily family income is about 30,000 KHR per day. 

Having a lot of competitive sellers is still the main challenge for her business. 

She is now applying for the first loan to buy more grocery items for resale via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She hopes that this timely loan will be able to get her more income to improve her family’s living more than before.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is 55-year-0ld, single woman, lives in Wihdat.  She lives with her siblings in the same home.  After she is retired from the public security, she decided to start her business to get her income and helps her siblings in the household expenses. She started to sell ready-clothes and blankets to her friends, family and neighbors.

Fadia has a lot of dreams; she wants to be a productive woman and depend on herself, therefore she is thinking to expand her work and increase her profits, therefore she applied for a loan to help her buy more clothes and blankets to sell and increase her income.

loans.use: to help her buy more clothes and blankets to sell and increase her incomes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more phones and cables to sell.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is 36 years old and a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Virgen de Fatima” está en su 11º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, además están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, a través del cual, y por medio de las capacitaciones podrán conocer su situación de vida y por medio de su trabajo superarla.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Roque, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que están en una situación de pobreza extrema, pero ella a través de los comportamientos de una mujer exitosa, y sumado a su trabajo de venta de prendas variadas quiere poner su esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
La Sra. Roque pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas, y de esa forma poder surtirse y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe, que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The “Virgen de Fatima” communal bank is in its 11th loan cycle and is also in the poverty elimination programme. Through this programme, and with some training, they will be able to understand their situation and improve it through their work.

One of the group members is Señora Roque, whose questionnaire showed that she falls into poverty level 1, which means that she is in a situation of extreme poverty. However, through the habits of a successful woman, and with her work selling various clothes, she wants to put all her efforts into improving her living conditions.

Señora Roque is asking for a loan in order to buy various clothes, and in this way stock up and fulfil the orders of her customers. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has, which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy various clothes to sell.

loans.name: Noujoud

texts.en:
Noujoud is a 40-year-old, divorced woman, who started two years ago, tailoring and selling clothes to cover her needs and expenses because she didn't have any source of income.

Today, Noujoud is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise with a new, fashionable summer clothes collection to satisfy her customers needs.

Noujoud hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new, fashionable summer clothes collection

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some spare parts for televisions and play station games which need replacing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put up a cow shed to protect his cattle from predators.

loans.name: Giants Women Group

texts.en:
Isatu is a member of Giants Women solidarity group. She sells raw fish.  Isatu has been selling raw fish for the past ten years.  She uses proceeds of her business in helping the husband to pay for their children’s education and to provide livelihood for her family.

Isatu and other group members of take away are requesting for their first loan. Isatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 5,000,000SLL. Isatu (in the middle of the group picture). Of this amount, Isatu will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which she will use to purchase more cartoons of raw fish for her business. She is thirty-five years, married with two children age ten and six are all primary school children.

She hopes that her business continue to exist so that she can save enough money to educate her children and also prepare for her old age. Fatmata hopes that this loan will earn her more profit for her to support her family.

Isatu and her group members thank you for financing there business

loans.use: to purchase more cartoons of raw fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a biological toilet filter system for his family and tenants

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase different types of drinks for her business.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 50-year-old married woman. She has been doing a business of bangle sales for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. Her husband’s income is not enough to fulfill the family needs. Therefore she started her own business to contribute to the family income. Sughran has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales and generate a healthier source of income. She has a good repayment history. She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs to increase her sales and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.name: Denis Antonio

texts.es:
Denis es un hombre trabajador y perseverante, desde que era adolescente comenzó a trabajar con su papá, mientras estudiaba. Cuando terminó sus estudios universitarios como ingeniero agrónomo, se dedicó por completo a ello, para  así mejorar las condiciones de vida de él y su familia. 

Sin embargo, solicita un financiamiento para instalar servicios higiénicos en su casa, de esta forma mejorará gradualmente las comodidades básicas de su hogar. Cabe destacar, que en varias comunidades del Nicaragua no se cuenta con condiciones salubres básicas, es por esto que los habitantes deben suplirlas por ellos mismos, en consiguiente MiCrédito ofrece este tipo de préstamos para ayudar a los habitantes de esas zonas.
texts.en:
Denis is a hardworking and persevering man. When he was a teenager he started to work with his father while he studies. When he finished his university studies in agricultural engineering, he worked in this field full time, in order to improve the living conditions for himself and his family.

However, he is asking for a loan in order to install sanitary facilities in his house, and in this way gradually improve the basic commodities of his home. It should be noted that various communities in Nicaragua do not have basic sanitary conditions, and this is why the residents have to provide these themselves. As a result, MiCredito is offering this type of loan in order to help residents of these areas.

loans.use: to install sanitary facilities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for her grocery to sell.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a single man living in Irbid. He is studying to get his bachelor's degree in economics, and he is now in his fourth year. The income that comes from his father’s job is the only income that his family has. Yazan’s future plan is to work in the economics field, and he wants to develop his experience in this field. Yazan is a very ambitious guy who wants to improve the standard of living for his family, and he is working hard to achieve his dreams. Recently he is facing some financial problems that lead him to apply for an educational loan to help him cover his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Heba

texts.en:
Heba has a small project which is making perfumes and selling them and has asked for a loan to improve her project to be able to buy tools and supplies for making more perfumes.

Heba is 27 years old, a married woman with one child. Her business is located in her home and her primary customers are regular.  She is managing her business and working hard to help her husband who is working with a low income. She has dreams she wants to achieve and this loan will help her to achieve her dreams.  She will use this loan to buy supplies and tools to increase her products. 

She wants to expand her work and increase her income to be able to save money and open an independent shop. 
Heba is waiting for your support.

loans.use: to buy supplies and tools to increase her perfume making activities

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.fr:
El grupo llamado “San Cayetano” tiene 20 integrantes, todas ellas mujeres jefas de familia, personas luchadoras que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Porfiria, quien se dedica a vender bebidas de todo tipo, se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, es por ello que le está yendo muy bien. Ella misma se define como una persona muy trabajadora que tiene las ganas de poder crecer y salir adelante.
 Porfiria al igual que sus demás compañeras está muy agradecida por la ayuda que reciben, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar gaseosas, vinos, cervezas, jugos y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The “San Cayetano” group has 20 members. All these women are heads of family and determined people who want to improve their living conditions. That is why they are also in the poverty elimination program in order to grow and get ahead.

One of the members is Porfiria, who makes a living selling all types of beverages. She has acquired a good clientele, which is why it is going well for her. She describes herself as a very hardworking woman who has a desire to be able to grow and get ahead.

Porfiria, along with her teammates, is very grateful for the help they are receiving, and says that she is requesting this loan to be able to buy soft drinks, wine, beer, juices, and other things, in order to continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, wine, beer, juices, and other drinks.

loans.name: Moatasem

texts.en: Moatasem is a single man, living in Ajloun with his family. Moatasem is studying nutrition at the university. His father’s income is not so good these days and he could not help him to cover his university fees. He is dreaming about his graduation day to be able find a good job and he wants to be a successful guy in the future. He needs the loan to help him pay for his semester fees and achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To drill a borehole in her house and start a water vending business

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is a repeat client to UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD. She is 45 years old,and a widow with 4 children with ages between 13 and 23 years old. All children go to school.  She is a farmer who has banana plantation and rears a few goats. She is a resident of Kahunga, Ntungamo town council,Ntungamo district, and he has applied for a loan of 2,000,000/=.

Kellen has decided to change her production to 100% organic, so the best option is to improve banana production. Kellen's dream is to present her children with a good example of how to work the earth with respect for it's purity and also educate them to have a better future. 

The loan will help Kellen to buy cow dung and dry grass to mulch her banana plantation. 
The organic banana production will allow her to obtain higher profit for his coffee and improve her family's quality of living. .

loans.use: To buy mulch and organic fertilizers for her banana plantation and inspire her children to follow her example

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of sachet water to resell

loans.name: Na Tau 17 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhung, 23, is married and the mother of a little girl who is four years old. They live together happily in a Thai ethnic traditional house. She is a young hardworking dynamic woman who not only works at agriculture production but also as a village nurse while her husband is a driver of a small truck.

Mrs. Nhung has diversified farming and breeding production with plenty of activities such as cultivating rice, potato, and raising chickens, pigs, ducks. She has recently requested a loan from the Anh Chi Em program to buy goats and piglets to increase production in animal husbandry. She hopes that along with the training and counseling provided by the program, her investment will go well and bring a good income for her family. 

Mrs. Nhung dreams that her daughter will grow up healthily, and have a good education and a bright future. In the picture, she wears a blue shirt and stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy goats and piglets to increase production in animal husbandry

loans.name: Reehana

texts.en:
Reehana is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing goods from the market for their inventory and by dealing with customers in the shop. Over time, they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products, and they make enough to meet the expenses of their seven children.

Currently, she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers for generating a healthier source of income. She is positive about her future earnings and will spend part of her income on more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater to more customers for generating a healthier source of income

loans.name: Filiberto

texts.es:
Filiberto se dedica a la agricultura, ésta es su principal fuente de ingresos desde hace más de treinta años. Gracias a los financiamientos de MiCrédito, ha podido apoyarse para que su producción este en tiempo y forma, por ejemplo con el ultimo crédito pudo comprar una bomba de riego y semillas pasa su siembra, esto le fue de ayuda porque pudo cosechar satisfactoriamente. 

Sin embargo, solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar semillas y abono para su próxima cosecha de apio. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá sembrar y fertilizar lo más pronto posible, de esta forma aprovechará el tiempo de siembra a cabalidad.   Filiberto planea aliarse con grandes empresarios para exportar sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Filiberto makes his living in agriculture; it has been his primary source of income for more than thirty years. Thanks to the loans from MiCrédito, he has been received the necessary support so that his harvest is on time and in good shape. For example, with the last loan, he was able to buy an irrigation pump and seeds for planting. This was helpful because he was able to get a satisfactory harvest.

Nevertheless, he is applying for a new loan to buy seeds and compost for his next celery crop. This will be helpful because he will be able to plant and fertilize as soon as possible. This way, he will make the most of the planting season.

Filiberto plans to join forces with large business owners in order to export his harvests.

loans.use: to buy seeds and compost for his next celery crop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more bags of wood/fuel for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick Lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is 32 years old and married with four children, two of whom attend school. He works in farming alongside buying and selling maize and beans. He hopes to expand and develop his business as well as to pay school fees for his children. He will use the loan facility to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years she has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and design, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business.

Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Kaneez expects an increase in her earnings with the loan, and she plans to spend part of her profits to provide a better life for her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Decore Group

texts.en:
Abass is a member of Decore solidarity group.  Abass has been selling drinks and provisions for the past six years.   He uses proceeds of his business to pay for his children’s education and to provide livelihood for his family.
Abass and other group members of Decore are requesting for their first loan. Abass and his group members are in need of a loan, 5,000,000SLL.

Of this amount, Abass will personally receive 1,000,000SLL which he will use to purchase more different types of drinks, cartons of soap, etc. for his business. 
Abass is forty two years old, married with five children age twenty, seventeen, fifteen and twelve are all secondary school children.

Abass hopes that his business will continue to exist so that he can save enough money to educate his children and also prepare for his old age. Abass hopes that this loan will earn him more profit for him to support his family.
 
Abass and his group members thank you for financing there business

loans.use: to purchase more different types of drinks, cartons of soap, etc for his livilihood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more timber and new machines, to attract more customers for more income gain

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John used the previous loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his house. He is a farmer, growing banana for sale.  He faces challenges of lack of capital, that hinder expansion of his business. Besides that, he is working very hard to make sure he increases his income. 

John needs a loan to paint his house.

loans.use: to paint his re-roofed house.

loans.name: Nabeeha

texts.en:
Nabeeha was born in 1973. She is a married woman living in a sector of Jordan called Rsaifeh with her husband and her four children. She is a conservative woman and asked her husband to take her place in the photo.

She currently runs her small grocery in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and to provide her children with the best education. Now she would like to add more kinds of products and food supplies to her business in order to expand her project and raise her profits. However, she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more kinds of products and food supplies to her grocery store

loans.name: Victoria Del Socorro

texts.es:
En algunas zonas del país no se cuenta con los servicios sanitarios necesarios para cuidar la salud de las personas, es por eso que MiCrédito ofrece financiamientos para la construcción de sanitarios que ayudarán a los habitantes de esas áreas a tener una mejor calidad de vida. 

Victoria es una habitante de esas zonas, por lo que solicita un crédito para construir un servicio higiénico. Ella siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer entregada, fuerte y trabajadora, desde niña trabajaba con su papá en cortes de café, luego se dedicó a ser asistente del hogar y ahora trabaja de conserje en una universidad para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
In some regions of the country, people can't count on the sanitary services needed to protect their health. That is why MiCredito offers financing for the construction of sanitary facilities that will aid the inhabitants of these areas to have a better quality of life.

Victoria resides in one of these zones, and for that reason, she is requesting a loan to construct her own hygienic services. She has always been a committed, strong and hard-working woman. Since childhood she worked with her father harvesting coffee. Later, she became a household helper and, now, she works as a janitor in a university in order to advance her children.

loans.use: construct a hygienic toilet facility for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more meat for resale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Hoima, Uganda and is a hardworking single lady with one child aged 19 years. She runs a boutique, mainly selling ladies wear and clothes for men. Her dream is to expand and develop her business more. Her biggest challenge is the constant changes of fashion designs. She will use the loan facility to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Buthaina

texts.en:
Bothayna has three children, one of them is Ghaidaa who is appear in the photo wth her mother Bothayna.  She and her husband want to ensure a comfortable life for their children.

Bothayna wants to educate her children and she is working hard to see them in a good job. So she applied for an educational loan to help her daughter Ghaidaa, who is studying foreign languages (Italian and English) to pay her university fees and be able to complete her education.

loans.use: to pay university fees for her daughter who is studying Italian and English

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is 20-year-old, single man and he lives in Irbid. Yousef is studying his bachelor degree in his second year majoring computer information systems.

His future plan is to take his degrees and find a good job. He is applying for a loan to help him to cover his semester fees because of the financial crisis that his family has been faced with.

loans.use: to pay his 2nd year university fees in computer information systems

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 25-year-old married woman who lives with her two daughters and her husband in Dair Alla. Her husband is working as a farmer with a low income, and because of the high cost of living, Iman decided to do something to help her husband.

One year ago, Iman started to buy used clothes and resell them at a profit, but she would like to improve her project and to start selling new items as well, such as kids' clothes and accessories.

Therefore, she applied for this loan to buy more used clothes and other kinds of products to sell from her home. This loan will support her efforts to reach her goal of increasing her income and being able to help her husband more and more.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes and other kinds of products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and install a biological toilet filter system for his family and tenants

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is 26 years old and married. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband doesn’t work. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with family in the Bilasuvar region. 

She is a farmer and started her work six years ago. Gunay is a capable, respected, organized, and also stable and professional person. In this work she has experience, but she is not happy with her work because nowadays, Gunay is so ill. She needs some money for her treatment. If Gunay has enough money she can receive treatment; thus, she can come back to her work. Soon, Gunay needs money for treatment as well as for her work. After that she will sow her land and then sell the produce. 

Her biggest dream is to expand the land and to plant more seeds; therefore, Gunay needs Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 31-year-old married father of three children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Sixteen years ago, he started working at repairing motorcycles. He has experience since childhood from his father. He is a hard worker who has a good reputation in his region for his professional skills. 

Today, Raed is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with more motorcycle spare parts which will help him satisfy his customers' special requests.

Raed hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle spare parts to increase his merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spray pumps for spraying her crops to protect them from insects and disease for a high yield harvest

loans.name: Kutimuy Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KUTIMUY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Josefa ella es soltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar aadelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The village bank "KUTIMUY" is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Maria Josefa, 60, is unmarried and has 3 children. She sells cereal grains including wheat, corn and quinoa. She works from 8:30am to 5pm. She's been in this business for 4 years and it's going very well. She is hardworking and dedicated to this business, which is how she hopes to help her family get ahead.Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her grains.

Maria Josefa is asking for a loan to buy wheat, corn and quinoa. She thanks those who are a part of her dream through this medium, and promises to make her payments in the established time period.

The other bank members have businesses including: snack sales, clothing sales, grocery stores and a school supply store.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old single man who started four years ago working as a barber to cover his needs and expenses. He is a hard worker and an ambitious man who succeeded throughout the years in gaining loyal customers.

Today, Mohammad is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business and decorate his shop in an attempt to attract more customers.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to develop his business through decorating his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of manufactured hairpieces, hair extensions and a blow drier for her beauty salon to meet client demand.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more different kinds of fruits like 5 bags of mangoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm tools such as jembe and fertilizers to enable him do his farming and get a better harvest for family and client needs.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.en:
Dayana is 50 years old, is married to Lamech and supports a family of five children.  She has been practicing poultry farming for the last 17 years, earning KES 17,000 per month. 

Dayana has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy good quality poultry feeds for her chickens so that they are healthy and well nourished for resale.  She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy good quality poultry feeds for her chickens so that they are healthy and well nourished for resal.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more produce like maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize, beans, and Irish potatoes for selling.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 20-year-old student who lives with his family in Salt, Jordan. His father works with a very low income, and his mother is not working. Khaled has three girl siblings.

He is a university student in his second year, majoring in mechanical engineering. Due to the need to continue the semester and pay all the fees, he applied for this educational loan in order to support him and be able to cover his university fees. 

Khaled hopes to graduate and find good work to help his father with the household expenses.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy yarn and cloth and replace her sewing machine to increase her production of hand made items.

loans.name: Sanga Catholic Savings&credit Group

texts.en:
John is a 35 year old, hardworking and still single living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a member of a village bank where they guarantee one another to get a loan. He sells fresh foods like tomatoes, matooke, greens and Irish potatoes. He started with capital from savings in their group and group loans. 

He is challenged with a hardship of low capital to buy a variety of fresh foods. John is requesting for a loan to buy more fresh foods like fresh beans and vegetables to sell. 

He is a member of Sanga Catholic savings & credit group where members guarantee each other to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods like fresh beans and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana es una mujer de 63 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y 3 hijas mayores de edad e independientes, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, fuerte, luchadora, constante, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa Salomé’ caracterizada por estar conectada con el resto de la ciudad mediante un camino angosto, el 50 por ciento de la zona cuenta con alcantarillado y agua potable, la otra mitad recibe agua a través de una vertiente. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -1/15 grados centígrados.
Emiliana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con sus hijos que son independientes. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; saice (carne molida y arroz), plato paceño (choclo, papa, habas, queso y carne), trucha frita, revuelto (papas fritas, carne molida, arvejas y arroz), sajta de pollo (pollo picante) y otros, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes para la hora de almuerzo, “trabajé en la cocina de un hospital durante varios años, actualmente vendo comida y quiero abrir una tienda de barrio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es el trabajo constante de la cocina que a su edad la tiene agotada. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de barrio para contar con una segunda actividad y poder descansar en su casa, ella desea abrir una tienda de barrio para la venta de alimentos de primera necesidad. Esta es su 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 30 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Emiliana solicita un préstamo para abrir una tienda de barrio para dejar de cocinar y trabajar desde su casa.
texts.en:
Emiliana, 63, has two sons and three daughters, all adults and independent. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother, strong, a fighter, constant, independent, responsible and very hardworking. Her business is being developed in the "Villa Salomé" area, characterised for being connected with the rest of the city via a narrow path. 50% of the zone has a sewage system and drinking water, the other half gets water from the runoff. It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies between 1 - 15 degrees centigrade during the day.

Emiliana has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair which she plaits. She is short, has a robust build, and she dresses traditionally in a sombrero, poncho and skirt. Her maternal language is Aymará which she speaks with her family, and she speaks Spanish for general culture and for her business. She shares her life with her children who are independent. They live in their own house built from brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, and a wooden floor. She has drinking water, electricity, gas and sewage drains.

Her business sells traditional food such as saice (ground meat and rice), plato paceño (corn on the cob, potato, beans, cheese and meat), fried trout, revuelto (fries, ground meat, peas and rice), sajta de pollo (spiced chicken) and others. Emiliana works Mondays to Fridays for lunch time. "I worked in a hospital kitchen for several years. Currently I sell food and I want to open a corner shop," she says. The advantage to her business is that she has daily sales, the disadvantage is the constant work in the kitchen which tires her out at her age. Her dream is to open a corner shop in order to have a second activity and to be able to rest at home. In the corner shop she wants to sell staple foods. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 30 years that she has been working at her business.

loans.use: to open a corner shop so she can stop cooking and work from home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 48 years old, married to Abel and supports four children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 12 years, earning KES 5,000 per month.

Margret has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy farm inputs like a new digging hoe, fertilizer and maize cereal seedlings for planting in her farm to yield high production.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like a new digging hoe, fertilizer and maize cereal seedlings for planting in her farm to yield high production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wheelbarrow for water transportation for more gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow for carrying her produce from the farm to market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bags for sale in the market so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline  is 37 years old, single with 6 children, living in Kasese Uganda; She sells crude salt and also owns a salt pan where she gets income to look after her family. She has been in that business for 2 years with a dream of having a good and healthy family with educated children. 

However, she is faced with the challenge of weather changes. This affects salt production levels.  Everline will use the facility to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy crude salt for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy bags of sugar and ginger for her ginger beer business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional drums and plastic covers for her business.

loans.name: Nyambu

texts.en: Nyambu is a married man. He operates a retail business, where he sells milk, bread, sugar, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more inventory of bread, sugar, milk, cooking oil, washing soap and other items. This will enable him to increase his sales and profits. His business goal is to be a mega-retailer in the region within five years. He hopes that, in the future, his business will grow. This is his third loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of bread, sugar, milk, cooking oil, washing soap and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a household latrine for her family and tenants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To connect piped water to her house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de materiales de escritorio como cuadernos, lapiceros y libros,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuadernos, libros y lapiceros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yolanda continues to earn a living selling office supplies such as notebooks, pencils and books. She is a hard working and entrepreneurial woman who wants to use this business to get her family ahead in life. She is asking for a loan to buy notebooks, books and pencils.

She is happy to have this loan and is committed to making the repayments.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, books and pencils.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top-dressing her crops, in order to get a better harvest for family's use and to sell the surplus in the market to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and feed, in hope that this will enable him to obtain more milk to sell and make more profit to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and supply for income gain

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional stocks of washing powder, soap, sugar, cooking flour and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools for high production and supplies for increased income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top-dressing his crops to add nutrients to the soil and obtain a better harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more and different types of articles for resale.

loans.name: Luz Faviola

texts.es:
Luz Faviola tiene 44 años de edad, es casada,sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su esposo en casa propia, en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Luz Faviola se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Luz Faviola espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Faviola, 44 is married, with no children. She lives with her husband in their own home, in a rural area of the Oyotún district which is located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque Region, on the north coast of Peru. The inhabitants of this district mainly work in agriculture, raising livestock and business.

Luz Faviola works raising livestock such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys among others. Her business is located at her home. She has 8 years experience in this business and with very good personal and professional references in the area. The loan she is asking for will be used to buy a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys and chickens among others, as well as buying balanced feed for them. With this loan Luz Faviola hopes to offer better produce to her customers which will allow her to generate more income and so as a result increase the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a risk taker. 

She operates a retail business where she sells homemade juices and baobab fruit. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are regular.  She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy more stock of baobab fruit snack and to buy a cooler box. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to open a café.

loans.use: buy more stock of baobab fruit snack and buy a cooler box.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia vende  tejidos, chompas, mantas y telares, la socia es una mujetr emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Bertha, makes a living through her handicrafts business. She sells textiles, sweaters, and blankets as well as other knitted and woven goods. The member is an entrepreneurial and determined woman. Through her business, she hopes to move her family forward.

Bertha is requesting a loan to buy textiles and sweaters as well as other knitted and woven goods. She is happy to receive this loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy textiles and sweaters as well as other knitted and woven goods.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 36-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, who all attend school. She is a housewife and her husband works very hard to help the family to live in good conditions. Given that her children will enter school very soon, Mariam is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to register them at school. The parents’ only target is to provide their children with a good educational path until graduation and help them become able to get good jobs that will give them a good income.

loans.use: to register her children at school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get a better harvest for family use, and to sell the surplus produce in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops to get a better harvest for family use and surplus produce for sale in the market.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua, 37 years old, is married and supports a family of 2 children. He is a small scale farmer who has been growing cash crops for the last 14 years.

Joshua will be using the loan to buy a dairy cow to get milk to sell to his customers and to make more profit to support his family. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes are to improve his farming, make more income and support his family.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to get milk to sell to his customers and to make more profit to support his family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and other miscellaneous expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for follow-up surgery after being in a traffic accident.

loans.name: Cordillera Group

texts.es:
Paola es una mujer  de 20 años d edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de Queques.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ localizado al sur de la ciudad, caracterizada por la multiculturalidad de sus pobladores; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, migrantes del todos los rincones del país, se apropiaron de la zona formando un comercio constante, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Paola es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (al centro viste, polera rosada y calza marrón). Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que todavía no se encuentran en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus deseos de generar mejores ingresos para el bienestar de sus bebes la llevó a liderar la banca de personas con negocios como; venta de vajillas, venta de celulares, venta de carne de pollo, venta de flores, servicio de té, venta de medicinas naturales y panadería, para solicitar un préstamo y prosperar en sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de Queques; El queque es un bizcocho que contiene ingredientes como; azúcar, miel, coco rallado, leche, huevos, harina, ralladura de limón o de naranja, polvos de hornear y bicarbonato, “metemos la masa al horno por 30 minutos, Cuando se enfría la cortamos en cuadros y la vendemos al paso...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de variedades de harinas como harina de arroz, de maíz y otras, para hornear nuevas variedades. Su sueño es abrir una panadería, ella desea realizar la compra de variedades de harinas por quintal para hornear diferentes tipos de queques y abrir una panadería. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Paola solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de harina para hornear varios tipos de queques y abrir una panadería.
texts.en:
Paola is a 20-year-old woman who lives with her partner and her two children, ages 2 and 4. Her business is selling cakes.

She is a good mother, enterprising, independent, constant, responsible and very hard working. Her business is developing in the “Plan 3000” zone, located to the south of the city. It is known for its multi-cultural population: Aymaras, Quechuas, and Guaranies – migrants from all corners of the country. They have moved into the zone, creating a constant commerce. The climate is hot, sub-tropical, with a termperature that varies during the day between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade.

Paola has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black hair fastened in back. She is short in stature and physically robust. Her maternal tongue is Guarani which she speak with her family and she speaks Spanish among the general populace and in her business. (You will see her in the center of the photo in a pink shirt and maroon sandals.) 

She leads her life accompanied by her partner, who is a construction worker, and her children, all of whom are school age. They live in a single room they built of wood with a corrugated roof and a dirt floor. They have potable water, electricity and a sewage system.

Her business is selling “cakes” – a biscuit containing ingredients like sugar, honey, shredded coconut, milk eggs, flour, shredded lime or orange, baking powder and bicarbonate of soda. Paola says “we put the batter in the oven for 30 minutes. When it cools we cut it into squares and sell it.”

Her goal of generating more income for the well being of her children led her to join this bank, which is composed of people with businesses such as selling table services, cell phones, chicken, flowers, tea, natural medicines, and bread -- in order to request loans and prosper in business. 

The advantage of her own business is that she can count on daily sales. The disadvantage is her lack of capital to purchase [in bulk] the required variety of flour – rice flour, corn flour, etc. – needed to bake new varieties. 

Paula's dream is to open a bakery. She wants to be able to purchase a variety of flour by the  hundred-weight so that she can bake different types of cakes and open a bakery. This is her third round of loans through this institution during her two years involved in this activity.

These are the reasons why Paula is requesting a loan – to purchase a variety of flour to bake various types of “cakes” and open her own bakery.

loans.use: purchase a variety of flour for baking various types of "cakes" and open a bakery.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is 39 years old, and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Night has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells home use items like sugar, water and cooing oil. 

To help expand her business, Night has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase enough stock of essentials, which include water, soap, cooking oil and others, and will help Night to generate greater profits and income. Night hopes that in the future, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living. 

Night is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Night, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase enough stock of essentials, which include water, soap, cooking oil and others.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 50-year-old Lebanese woman living with her husband and four children, two of whom attend school. Her husband works in a company with the aim to fulfill the family's needs and enhance their lifestyle. Mariam will use her loan requested from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l,, to pay her children’s educational fees. This makes her very happy and optimistic and willing to always borrow Kiva loans to continue paying the fees.

loans.use: to pay her children’s educational fees

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
El socio Crisologo se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa, el socio es una persona que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. El socio solicita el crédito para comprar casacas, blusas y pantalones.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member, Crisologo, continues to make a living through his clothing sale business. Through this business, he hopes to move his family forward.

Crisologo is requesting a loan to buy dress coats, shirts, and pants. He is happy to receive this loan, and he promises to make his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy dress coats, shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry feeds for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a wheelbarrow for transportation of bricks for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize cereals for selling to clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to  get more milk to supply to clients.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as loyal. 

She operates a retail business where she sells flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a populated place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items. This will enable her increase sales and profits.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified fertilizers and herbicides to improve her productivity

loans.name: Rojo Group

texts.es:
Está conformado por tres mujeres luchadoras (Linda Roxana, Magdalena Celia y Melida)  que se organizaron hace 3 años, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para sus pequeños negocios de: venta de cosméticos y granos básicos, con el deseo de mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios.

Linda Roxana: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven amable con cualidades de líder y deseos de superación. Originaria de la Ciudad de Bilwi, municipio de puerto cabezas, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Está casada, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad que cursa su segundo grado de primaria. Su esposo trabaja como docente. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hijo, desde hace 4 años vende cosméticos y ropa nueva en su tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: perfumes, cremas, ropa nueva y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three determined women (Linda Roxana, Magdalena Celia y Melida) who got together three years ago with the aim of getting funding for their small businesses: selling cosmetics and basic grains, with the hope of improving their incomes and improving their living conditions, to be able to cover their basic household needs, to ensure their children get education and to expand their businesses.

Linda Roxana is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a friendly young woman with the qualities of a leader and with a desire to get ahead. She is originally from Ciudad de Bilwi, in the municipality of puerto cabezas, she belongs to the miskita ethnic group. She is married and has a 6 year old child who is in second grade of primary school. Her husband works as a teacher. With the aim of having her own source of income, contributing to the household expenses and the education of her child, she started to sell cosmetics and new clothes four years ago in the stall that she has in one of the markets in Bilwi. She is asking for funding to buy perfumes, creams and new clothes in Managua and to sell them at affordable prices to her customers. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and new clothes in Managua.

loans.name: Jorge Giancarlos

texts.es:
Jorge Giancarlos tiene 20 años de edad, vive en casa familiar junto a sus padres.Él vive en la parte rural del Caserío Playa Azul que pertenece al distrito de Pucará y cuenta con servicios de luz, en la provincia de Jaén, Región Cajamarca, Sierra Norte de Perú.

La actividad que Jorge Giancarlo realiza es la de perforación de rocas para construccion ,estas actividades las realiza en el caserío de Playa Azul y sectores aledaños esta labor le permite solventar el crédito sin ningún problema. El destino del crédito será para invertir en servicio de mantenimiento de sus herramientas de trabajo, así podrá generar mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida .Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona y con ello obtiene buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge Giancarlos, 20, lives in his family home with his parents. He lives in the rural part of a small village called Playa Azul which belongs to the Pucará District in the Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, in the Sierra Norte of Peru.

Jorge Giancarlos works drilling rocks for construction, and is based in the small village of Playa Azul and surrounding areas. This work allows him to repay the loan without any problems. The loan will be used to invest in the maintenance of his work tools. He will also be able to generate more income and so improve his quality of life. There is no major competition in the area and he earns a good income.

loans.use: maintain his work tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To connect piped water to her house

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old, and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, cooking oil and other items. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more essentials for the shop, which will increase her sales, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits.  Increased sales will help her send her kids to study in better schools. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life with her kids. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more essentials for her shop to increase her sales,

loans.name: Kazungu

texts.en:
Kazungu is married and he has 6 children. He describes himself to be honest. For the past 5 years, Kazungu has operated a retail business selling flour, sugar, cooking oil, rice and other items. His business is located in a populated area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

Kazungu will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is Kazungu's third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. Kazungu will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm chemicals for spraying for high production and supply to gain more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to apply modern technology to farming with greenhouse farming in order to improve her productivity

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Kadiatu. She is married and has three children aged 12, 6 and 1 year. In 2007, Kadiatu established her cream, powder and soap business. She began her business because she did not further her education due to no financial support. Her business is located in at a city center, and her main customers are women. 

Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about SLL 800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL5,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of cream, powder, soap, etc., for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her to increase the level of her additional income. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to build a shop for more business expansion. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cream of different kinds for resale

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca una señora de 53 años, casada, es una gran persona, una mujer humilde, sencilla y servicial que tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde usa sus valores y  habilidades para relacionarse con las personas.

Junto con sus vecinos ha creado un lindo vínculo logrando generar confianza, a pesar de no contar con mucho surtido debido a la falta de capital para ampliar su inventario, pues sus sueños es expandirse, generar empleo, tener sostenibilidad y transformar su tienda en un supermercado.

Blanca inicio a trabajar con la intención de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de la canasta familiar.
Con su apoyo Blanca podrá seguir su sueño.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 53-year-old woman who is married and a successful individual. She is a humble, straightforward, and giving woman who operates a grocery business. Her values and abilities enable her to relate to other people.
