Blanca and her neighbors have established a wonderful bond of trust even though she lacks many products due to the lack of capital needed to expand her inventory. Her dreams are to expand, create jobs, experience sustainability, and transform her store into a supermarket. She also wants to begin working with the intention of improving her living conditions.

Blanca is requesting a loan in order to buy a stock of household products. With your support, she can continue toward her dream.

loans.use: to buy basic household products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 36-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three aged school children.   She started her own business in 2005 with the aim to help her husband financially and to be able to live a respectable life. She raises cattle, specifically cows, and she produces daily fresh milk which she sells to multiple customers and traders. 

She is happy of what she gained so far, but she wants to improve her work more and more, that’s why she seeks to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to purchase fodder to feed the cows and to be able to increase the quantity of milk that she produces and therefore her income.

loans.use: to purchase more fodder to feed her dairy cows

loans.name: Maha

texts.en: Maha is a 35-year-old Lebanese divorced woman with one child. She lives with her brother, who is the income provider in the family, and Maha helps him as she receives expenses from her ex-husband. She states that living costs are becoming very expensive. Maha is in real need of borrowing a loan from Kiva's partner, Vitas s.a.l., to cover her child's study fees. Her first goal is to ensure a good educational level for her child.

loans.use: to cover her child's study fees

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 43 years old Hawa. She is married and has 4 children, age 21, 18, 8 and 6. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her, one for school and the other to assist her in her business.  In 2010, Hawa established her clothing sales and dishes business.  She began her business just to provide assistance to her husband. Her business is located at the city center and her main customers are both men and women.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. 

Hawa would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more pans, dishes and rubber dishes for resale.  She hopes that this loan will increase her stock levels.   In the future, Hawa still plans to educate her kids, to send her kids abroad and to build a house. She is saying thanks to Kiva, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pans and dishes for her shop for resale.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man. He has three children. He operates a retail business where he sells onions. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of onions. His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to open other business branches.

loans.use: to buy more stock of onions

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah is aged 30 years old, married to Abel and supports four children. She has been a shopkeeper for the the last two years, and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more stock of goods and products, such as sugar, for sale to clients to meet client and family needs.

She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand her business sector. Her hope is to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods and products, such as sugar, for sale to clients to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, sodas and soap for his retail shop

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which she owns a retail shop which sales sugar, cooking oil, clothing and other items. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy and stock more essentials for the shop, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and increase her sales, hence taking her kids to study in better schools. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to have a better life with her children. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy and stock more clothing essentials in her shop,

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah, 33 years old, lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has five children, two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Peninah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand her business, Peninah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add different household items such as milk, soap and detergents to sell in her store. This will help Peninah to generate greater profits and increase her stock, which will attract more customers to her business. Peninah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to increase her profits and own another business of the same kind. 

Peninah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Peninah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add different household items such as milk, soap and detergents to be sold in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of clothing for sale to meet clients' demands and those of her family.

loans.name: Benardin

texts.en:
Residing in Ibanda in the Mbarara region of Uganda, Benardin is 48 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, he has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells home-use items. 

To help expand his business, Benardin has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase essentials such as sugar and salt. This will help him generate greater profits and open up other businesses, thereby creating more jobs in his community. Benardin hopes that in the future he will be able to educate his kids in better schools. 

Benardin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Benardin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase essentials like sugar and salt to increase his profit

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man, with 2 children. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a populated place and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. he will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy more stocks of charcoal

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
This is 52 years old Fatu.  She is married and has 3 children aged 30, 20 and 15yrs. In 2004, Fatu established her cosmetics shop business.   She began her business because she wants to help her husband to take care of the home.   Her business is located at the city centre and her main customers are both men and women.   Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 700,000SLL every month from this business.   

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000SLL. Fatu requires a new loan in order to buy more cosmetics like soap, spray, creme, powder, etc.  for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her increase and to get additional income. In the future, Fatu plans to build a shop for more business expansion.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 30 years old Mohamed.  He is single, and has 1 child aged 5yrs. In 2007, Mohamed established his electric appliances business.   He began his business because he did not continue with his education because of lack of financial support.   

His business is located at the central market. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, he earns about 600, 000SLL every month from this business.   He would like a loan in the amount of 5, 000,000 SLL. Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more mobile phones for resale.  

In the future, Mohamed plans to educate his children, build a house and to seek more loans from ARD.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones for resale

loans.name: Tweimukye Nkenda Group

texts.en:
Andrew, 48 years old, is a married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has 2 children who both attend school. Andrew owns a liquor store, selling local brew, and he also farms. Having been in this business for over 10 years, Andrew has been able to pay fees for his children and build a permanent house. He dreams of buying a car to help him transport his stock to the city. 

Andrew wants a loan to buy local brew to resell. He is a member of Tweimukye Nkenda group, whose members guarantee each other to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy local brew (waragi) to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, a married father of one, is a farmer and salesperson from Thubuku village in Kenya. He keeps cows, poultry and goats on his farm for milk, eggs and meat, which are his main income sources. William also makes a commission on sales of cereal grains, which he aggregates from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers. Since 2009, when he started this business, he has learnt the importance of building strong relationships and networks in business. 

Since William can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers, he prefers to stock large volumes of cereals. He is therefore seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers. Using his understanding of the market conditions and prices, he will sell the produce at a better price. 

Income from this investment will help William generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, cement, brick, sand, poles, and nails in order to change the roof of his kitchen and to build a wall in the patio of his home.

loans.name: Yelba Emilia

texts.es:
Doña Yelba tiene 60 años de edad, es muy reconocida en la zona donde vive ya que trabajo durante 22 años en la Alcaldía de Coronado como secretaria, debido a su experiencia y años de trabajar manejando materia judicial le asignaron casos penales, contravencionales y de pensiones; por recomendación médica ella debió retirarse del puesto para lograr nuevamente un equilibrio en su vida. Después de pensionarse ella quería invertir su liquidación en algo realmente importante, fue ahí donde recordó que su esposo iba abandonar la talabartería que tanto le había costado iniciar ya hace 10 años, pero por falta de capital fijo no podía continuar, en ese momento doña Yelba pensó en invertir su liquidación en la compra de equipo para la talabartería familiar. Desde el momento que ella se involucró más en la actividad notaron mejoras y aumento de clientela ya que lo que le corresponde realizar a doña Yelba hasta el día de hoy son las negociaciones, compra de materia prima y las giras para entregar la mercadería. La talabartería tiene 20 años de funcionar y doña Yelba participa activamente en ella desde hace 10 años. Necesita invertir el monto solicitado en la compra de materia prima ya que la última inversión que se realizo fue para comprar una troqueladora Industrial que les facilitara el trabajo y para trabajar con mayor rapidez, porque los clientes demandan mayor cantidad de productos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito.
Este negocio de la talabartería siempre ha sido de calidad y con un excelente acabado ya que cuentan con las máquinas necesarias que logran ese acabado, sus productos son muy variados y siempre llevan un sello costarricense ya que reflejan nuestra cultura con su arte, confeccionan desde aretes, llaveros, monederos, bolsos, fajas, pulseras y demás productos de cuero. Estos productos los venden a los negocios y cruceros de Limón, Tamarindo, Liberia, Puntarenas, Nicoya, Jaco, Dominical, Flamingo, Paquera, Brasilito, Samara y Playas del Coco. 
En esta talabartería los encargados de confeccionar los productos son el esposo de doña Yelba y dos de sus hijos, en época alta como lo son estos meses contratan a dos vecinos nicaragüenses que ya cuentan con la suficiente experiencia para colaborar.
texts.en:
Yelba is 60 years old. She is well known in the area where she lives as she worked for 22 years in the Coronado City Hall as a secretary. Because of her experience and years of working handling judicial matters they assigned her criminal cases, misdemeanors, and pensions. She resigned the position on medical advice in order to once again achieve balance in her life.

After retiring she wanted to invest her pension settlement into something really important and then she remembered that her husband was going to abandon the leather goods business that was so hard to start ten years before because he could not continue due to lack of working capital. It was at that moment that Yelba had the thought of investing her pension payment to buy equipment for the family leather goods shop. From the moment she became more involved in the work they noticed improvements and an increase in customers. What Yelba has done up until now is handle negotiations, the purchasing of raw materials, and merchandise delivery trips.

The leather goods shop has been in business for 20 years and Yelba has been actively participating in it for 10 years. She needs to invest the requested amount in the purchase of raw materials. The last investment that she made was for the purchase of an industrial punching press to facilitate their work in order to work faster because the clients are asking for more products. This is why she is asking for the loan. 

This leather goods business has always been one of quality with excellent finish, because they have the necessary machines to achieve the finish. Their products are varied and always carry a Costa Rican seal as it reflects the culture with their art, the making of earrings, key rings, wallets, handbags, bracelets and other leather goods. They sell these products to businesses and cruise ships from Limón, Tamarindo, Liberia, Puntarenas, Nicoya, Jaco, Dominical, Flamingo, Paquera, Brasilito, Samara y Playas del Coco.

In this leather goods business Yelba’s husband and two sons create the leather goods and during high season, such as these months, they hire two Nicaraguan neighbors who have enough experience to collaborate.

loans.use: for the purchase of raw materials for the family leather good shop

loans.name: Rosert

texts.en:
Rosert is 40 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past five years, Rosert has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, cooking oil, and other items. 

To help expand her business, Rosert is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy essentials to sell at her store. The loan will help Rosert to improve her shop, generate more profit, and provide for her family's basic needs. In the future, Rosert hopes to expand her business to a bigger store. 

Rosert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy essentials to sell at her store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kasaganti in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom currently attend school. For the past six years, Robert has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more phone accessories to sell. The loan will increase his profits and allow him to provide for his children's basic needs and tuition fees. In the future, Robert hopes to have a good and productive life. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more phone accessories

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario Antonio tiene 54 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y una hija dependiente, en casa propia en el distrito de Cayalti, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú. El distrito de Cayaltí una zona rural donde la vida es muy tranquila y armoniosa, y los pobladores se dedican mayormente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Mario Antonio se dedica a la actividad de taller de mecanica. Esta activdad la realiza desde hace mas de 10 años en un local propio, con muy buenas referencias. El presente crédito será utlizado para invertir en materiales para su taller. Con esto él podrá mejorar el servicio que brinda y por lo mismo podrá generar mayores ingresos que le permitirán mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mario Antonio is 54 years old and lives with his wife and a dependent daughter. They own a house in the District of Cayaltí, which is located in Chiclayo Province and lies in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. The District of Cayaltí is a rural area where life is extremely peaceful and harmonious. Most of the residents engage in agriculture, livestock breeding, and trade.

Mario Antonio operates an auto repair shop. He has been conducting his business out of his own shop for more than 10 years. Mario has very good references. His current loan will be used to invest in supplies for his shop. As a result, he will be able to improve the service he offers and also generate more income so that he and his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his repair shop.

loans.name: Wilma Florentina

texts.es:
Wilma es una mujer de 37 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 14 años y una hija de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de mantas de cholita.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, constante, independiente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cruce villa Adela’ que se caracteriza porque se encuentran asentadas diferentes instituciones como parroquias y unidades educativas de alto nivel e institutos superiores; lo más importante es que se cuenta con el Policlínico para el cuidado médico de los ciudadanos que habitan la zona y sus alrededores.
Wilma es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de mantas de cholita; la ‘cholita’ es una mujer de vestir tradicional, parte de su vestimenta es la manta, esta sirve para cubrir la espalda y los hombros del frio, “inicié mi actividad vendiendo polleras, vendo ambulantemente y ya cuento con clientes continuos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus ventas con continuas, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en la compra de mercadería. Su sueño es abrir una tienda propia para dejar de ambular, ella desea realizar la compra de mantas de cholita para la venta de ferias y mercados de otra ciudad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Wilma solicita un préstamo para la compra de mantas de cholita para vender en otras ciudades y con los beneficios abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Wilma is a woman of 37 years. She lives with her partner, and she has a 14 year old son and a 16 year old daughter. She sells traditional Bolivian shawls ("Cholita shawls"). She is a good mother and businesswoman: persevering, independent, responsible and hard-working. She developed her business in the neighborhood of "Cruce Villa Adela". It is known for being host to a lot of institutions, such as parishes and institutes of higher education. Most importantly, the neighborhood hosts the polyclinic, which cares for the citizens who live in the area.

Wilma has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair which she keeps in a braid. She is short, physically strong and dresses in traditional clothing (hat, shawl and traditional skirt). Her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks with her family. She also speaks Spanish for everyday use and to conduct business. She lives with her partner, who works in construction, as well as with her children, who are in school. They live in their own house, constructed from bricks and cement, with a calamine roof and a wooden floor. The house has running water, electricity, gas and a sewage system.

Her business is the sale of Cholita shawls. A "cholita" is a woman who dresses in traditional clothes. Part of her dress is the shawl, which she uses to protect her back and shoulders from the cold. "I started the business selling "polleras" (traditional skirts). I move around selling my goods and I already have regular customers." she says. The advantage of her business is that her sales are steady. The disadvantage is the lack of capital in order to invest in merchandise.

Her dream is to buy her own store so that she can stop peddling. Wilma hopes to buy more shawls to sell them at festivals and markets in another town. This is her first loan with this organization in the two years that she has been running her business. This is why Wilma is requesting a loan to buy Cholita shawls to sell in other towns and use the profits to open her own store.

loans.use: to buy traditional Bolivian shawls to sell in other towns and use the profits to open her own store.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli, 24, lives in Kutaisi, Georgia, with his wife. Irakli earns an income for his family by working as a petrol attendant. Each month, he earns 200 GEL, which makes it very difficult to meet the family's basic needs. Irakli wants to start a more profitable private activity and sought credit among local financial institutions. However, his attempts to obtain a loan were unsuccessful because he is poor.

Therefore, Irakli applied for a loan from the startup program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives poor people loans to start or improve their businesses. He is seeking a loan for $1,900 to purchase a secondhand car to work as a taxi driver. The loan will significantly increase his family's income and improve their living conditions.

Irakli and his wife rely on a goodwill of the lenders and are very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a car to operate a taxi

loans.name: Esther Angelica

texts.es:
Esther es una mujer de 24 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 8 años, y su negocio es la artesanía en madera.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprensiva, solidaria, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en diferentes ferias de la ciudad, como la ‘Alasitas’; que es una feria artesanal cuya característica principal es la venta de miniaturas con la finalidad ritual de que las mismas se conviertan en realidad.
Esther es de piel morena como la tierra, ojos pardos, cabello negro y largo como la noche, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja en carpintería y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la artesanía en madera; ella elabora adornos de pared, como relojes, cuadros, estantes, y otros. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y su esposo la ayuda con los materiales como, madera, pegamento, pintura, etc., “trabajo en la feria de Alasita desde niña, mis antepasados ya trabajaban aquí y así nos mantenemos hace muchas generaciones, siempre he pensado que hacerlo es una cuestión de fe y tradición…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su mercado es dinámico y las artesanías se venden continuamente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una máquina cortadora de madera para dejar de alquilar máquinas. Su sueño es producir en mayor cantidad para distribuir y vender por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que desarrolla esta actividad independientemente. 
E por esos motivos que Esther solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de cortar madera para dejar de alquilar y producir por mayor.
texts.en:
Esther is a 24 year old woman who is married with two children aged 8 and 2 years.  Her business is wood handicrafts.  She is a good mother, understanding, caring, patient, responsible, enterprising and very hard working.  

She does business in different fairs in the city, like the "Alasitas" artisan fair whose principle characteristic is the sale of miniatures with the traditional hope that the miniatures will convert into reality.

Esther has earthy skin tones, hazel coloured eyes, long black hair, is short of stature and physically strong.  Her native language is Aymará which she speaks among family, while speaking spanish for general culture and the business she works in.  She shares her life with her husband, who is a carpenter, and with her children; the eldest studies at school while the youngest is not yet of school age.  They live in their family home, which is made of brick and cement with wooden floors and a corrugated iron roof, where they have drinking water, electricity, gas and sewer.

Her business is wooden handicrafts, and she makes wall ornaments such as clocks, frames, bookcases and other items. She sells as a street vendor and her husband helps her with materials such as wood, glue, paint etc.  Esther says "I have worked in the Alasitas fair since I was a girl, my ancestors worked there and we have maintained ourselves in this way for many generations; I have always thought that this work is a matter of faith and tradition".   

The advantage of her business is that her market is dynamic and the handicrafts continually sell.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital for the purchase of a wood cutting machine, with which she could stop renting machines.  Her dream is to produce in larger quantity to be able to distribute and sell wholesale.  For this reason Esther is requesting a loan to buy a wood cutting machine to stop renting and be able to produce wholesale quantities.

This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 12 years she has worked in this business independently.

loans.use: to buy a wood cutting machine to stop renting them and to produce wholesale quantities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock of cooking charcoal for sale in the market so as to meet client needs.

loans.name: Ezriel

texts.en:
Ezriel is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kabwohe in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which she sells house hold items like bread,water and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Ezriel has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other more essential items like sugar,rice to increase on her sales, and will help her to generate greater profits and stock enough essentials for her customers. She  hopes that in the future she will be able to expanding her business into a mini supermarket. 

Ezriel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ezriel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy other more essential items like sugar, rice to increase her sales,

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vicent is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasaganti in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. For the past 8 years, Vicent has been working hard to manage his maize milling business. 

To help expand his business, Vicent has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more machines, which will allow him to enter the chicken feed milling business. By increasing his sales, Vicent will be able to generate greater profits, enroll his children in better schools, and improve his life. In the future, Vicent hopes to be the main supplier of poultry feed in the whole town. 

Vicent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vicent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more milling machines and enter the chicken feed business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old, married to Mary and supports a family of 3 children. 

He has been operating in the motorcycle transport for the last 3 years earning KES 8,500 per month.

Daniel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable with large rental estates.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en: Abigael is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a remote place. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy cow feeds. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy cow feeds for her dairy cattle

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 35 years old Abdul.  He is married, and has 2 children aged 9 and 3yrs-. In 2001, Abdul established his drugs  (patient drugs store) business. He began his business because there was no job he decided to be self employed and to support his family. His business is located at central market and his main customers are both men and women.   Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about 650,000SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 6,000,000SLL. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more medications and drugs for resale. He hopes that this loan will support him to increase his stock level.   

In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children and to seek more funds from ARD and to build his house.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medications and drugs for resale.

loans.name: Bwikara Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Sadam is a Ugandan who is aged 42 years and married with 11 children. 6 of his children are attending school in Kagadi. 

Sadam owns a butcher shop as his stable source of income, while he also earns side income from vehicle transportation. He works hard to satisfy his growing family's needs and educate all of his children. However, his business suffers from limited capital. 

In the future, Sadam hopes to see all of his children educated and the construction of his house completed. 

Sadam would like to take a loan to buy goats and cows to slaughter. He is a member of Bwikara Tweyimukye Group where members guarantee each other to access a loan since they cannot pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to slaughter and sell the meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy baking flour for making pastries, cereals and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sodas, mineral water, and other bottled soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 30 years old, and she lives in the town of Kisasi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 5 years, she has been working hard to manage her salon business where she does hairdressing. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 4,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hairdressing items for her salon such as dryers and hair braids, and it will help her generate greater profits. She is working hard to manage both her business and her family status as well. She hopes that in the future she will be able to own another related business in town. 

Getrude is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Getrude who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hairdressing items for her salon such as dryers and hair braids.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 28 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her hairdressing salon. 

To help expand her business, Lydia is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair waves and relaxers for her salon. The loan will help Lydia to generate greater profits and improve her family's living situation. In the future, Lydia hopes to open another salon in town. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lydia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hair waves and relaxers for her salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, insecticides etc. to increase his crop and thus achieve a better quality of life for his family

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La socia Monica se sigue dedicando al negocio de asesora de inmobiliaria, la socia es una persona trabajadora que por medio de este negocio quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Monica is still making a living with her real estate consultancy business. She is a hard-working person that wants to support her family through this business. She is asking for a loan to buy a stereo for her house. She is happy for the loan and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy a stereo for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy the local brew to resell

loans.name: Baikazi Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Xaviour is a Ugandan living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is aged 54 years. He owns drug shops, selling both human and veterinary medicines. His profession as a nurse led him to start up this business, having failed to get formal employment. 

Xaviour wants to take a loan to buy drugs to resell. He is a member of Baikazi Kweterana, a group where members guarantee each other to get a loan since they cannot pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy drugs for resale.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly is 48 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past six years Milly has been working hard managing her small grocery shop where she sells sugar, cooking oil and other items.

To help expand her business Milly has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from Kiva's field partner BRAC Uganda to buy more essential items like water and rice. An increase in inventory will help her to generate greater profits, purchase yet more stock and so attract more customers to her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a mini-supermarket and so create more jobs in town.

Milly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like her who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential inventory such as water and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins for his farm animals, and thus be able to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her farming business of raising and milking cows.  

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy milking machines that will make the process easy for her so that she can sell enough milk to her customers. This will help Margret to generate greater profits and someday manage a big farm that will supply a lot of milk to all the milk shops. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to own enough cows to create jobs in her community. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Margret who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy milking machines that will make the process easy for her so that she can sell enough milk to her customers,

loans.name: Mahmarasul

texts.ru: Махмарасаул 58 летный житель района Чиликул. Он женат и имеет детей. Махмарасул очень давно начал животноводческую деятельность. Он хорошо знает свою работу и знает как вести бизнес. Махмарасул был юношам, когда его отец научил его ухаживать о домашних животных. Он умный и серьезный человек.  Махмарасул быстро освоил деятельность отца, и до сегодняшнего дня продвигает бизнес. Он хочет купить коров для бизнеса. Махмарасул хочет доить коров и продать молоко в жители района, и путем дохода молоко купить еще пару коров. Он в дальнейшем хочет расширить животноводческую деятельность.
texts.en:
Mahmarasul is a 58-year-old resident of the Jilukul region. He is an intelligent and serious man who is married with children. He started an animal husbandry business a long time ago; he is very knowledgeable in his field and understands how to run a business. He was a young man when his father taught him to care for domestic animals. He quickly learned the trade from his father and has continued the business to this day.

Mahmarasul wants to buy cows for his business. He wants to milk the cows and sell the milk to local residents, then buy two more cows with profits from the milk. He wants to expand his business even more in the future.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in purchasing corn, cheese, flour, butter, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools and certified seeds for planting to increase production and gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to expand his farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease land and  plant nappier grass for his cows.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 44 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children with 5 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Christine has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal.  

To help expand her business, Christinen has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sacks of charcoal to increase her stock. This will help Christine to generate greater profits and have a car that will help her transport the charcoal to her customers. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business and own a bigger store so as to start supplying all small charcoal stores around town. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase for more sacks of charcoal to increase on the stock,

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru:
На фотке Вы видите Насибу и ее швейную машинку. Она швея, и начала свою работу год назад. Насиба просто обожает шить. Она семейная девушка. У нее пока нет детей, но она очень стать мамой. Муж Насибы работает фотографом. Он любить фотографировать, и выбрал себе свою любимую профессию. Насиба вместе мужем живет в районе Руми очень давно. 
Насиба давно живет в старом доме. Они давно не ремонтировали свой дом. Сейчас Насиба и ее муж решили отремонтировать дом и улучшить жилищные условия до рождения ребенка, чтобы с ребенком жили уютно и комфортно. У Насибы проблема с финансами, к сожалению, она не смогла приобрести стройматериалы для ремонта дома. По этой причине она обратилась к Вам за кредитом.
texts.en:
In the photo you see Nasiba and her sewing machine. She is a seamstress, and began her work a year ago. Nasiba simply adores sewing. She is a family-oriented woman. She does not yet have children, but she really wants to become a mother. Nasiba's husband works as a photographer. He loves photography, and has chosen it as his profession. 

Nasiba and her husband have lived together for a long time in the Rumy region. They have lived in an old house for a long time, and have not repaired it. Now, Nasiba and her husband have decided to repair the house and improve their living conditions before the birth of their child, so that they can live cozily and comfortably with their baby. Unfortunately, Nasiba has problems with finances, and has not been able to acquire building materials for the repair of her home. For this reason, she has come to you for a loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and repair her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in rolls of fabric, thread, elastic, etc. to have on hand for several customer orders.

loans.name: Eleonore

texts.fr: Eléonore a 60 ans, elle est mariée et leurs cinq enfants sont déjà mariés actuellement. Eléonore, malgré son âge avancé reste toujours une femme travailleuse et dynamique. En plus, c'est une femme qui n'aime pas dépendre de ses enfants, c'est pourquoi elle tient toujours continuer à exercer son activité de poissonnerie pour assurer sa survie ainsi que son futur. Cette activité constitue son occupation depuis très long temps, depuis 1993. Pendant sa jeunesse, à part la vente des poissons, elle pêchait elle-même soit à la ligne soit au filet les bonnes parties des poissons qu'elle vendait. C'est une femme courageuse et débrouillarde.
texts.en:
Eléonore is 60 years old. She is married, and her five children are also already married. Despite her years, Eléonore is still a dynamic working woman. In addition, she is a woman who dislikes being dependent on her children, which is why it is important for her to keep her business as a fishmonger, to insure her subsistence as well as her future.

This business has been her employment for a very long time, since 1993. In her youth, in addition to selling the fish, she used to fish herself most of the fish she sold, either with a line or a net. She is a brave, resourceful woman.

loans.use: to buy seafood (shrimps, crabs...), dried dish, and freshwater fish

loans.name: Aukatangni Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario AUKATANGNI, es en vocablo miskito que significa Flor de Bejuco. Está conformado por 1 hombre y 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Sarmiento, Alba Marina, Aida Adelia y Lucha), viven en  Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace 2 meses se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos, cosméticos y joyas de acero, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. 

Sarmiento: Es el coordinador del grupo solidario, tiene 45 años de edad, casado con dos hijas: La mayor de 22 años estudia su carrera universitaria y la menor de 20 su segundo año de secundaria. Su esposa trabaja de manera informal, como ayudanta de un negocio. Debido a la falta de empleo y con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 3 años inicio vendiendo ropa usada de manera ambulante, gracias a las ganancias percibidas y al crédito anterior otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos y establecer una pulpería en el corredor de su casa de tambo de madera. Solicita su segundo financiamiento para comprar: chiverías, granos básicos, papel higiénico, entre otros productos. El sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa usada y tener su propio tramo.
texts.en:
The solidarity group name, AUKATANGNI, is a Miskito word for bejuco flower. It consists of 1 male and 3 female entrepreneurs (Sarmiento, Alba Marina, Aida Adelia y Lucha). They live in Bilwi, a township of Puerto Cabezas. 2 months ago, they formed a solidarity group to access loans in Pana Pana so that they can improve their small businesses selling basic grains, cosmetics and jewelry made of steel. It also increases their income in order to improve the quality of life of their families.

Sarmiento: The coordinator of the solidarity group, is 45 years old, married and has two daughters. Older daughter is 22 years old and studies for university degree. Younger daughter is 20 years old in her sophomore year. His wife works informally as a helper. Due to the lack of employment and in order to raise his family, he began selling used clothing three years ago. Thanks to the profits and the previous loans granted by PANA PANA and KIVA, he was able to diversify the products and establish a general store in the corridor of his wooden stilt house. He requests a second loan to buy snacks, grains, toilet paper, among other products. He hopes to establish a used clothing store and have his own section.

loans.use: to buy snacks, grains, toilet paper, among other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy radios, remote controls, players, torchlight and flashlights.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Мухаббату 35 лет. Она из района Руми. Мухаббат замужем и мать двоих детей. Дети маленькие ходят в садик. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Мухаббат на районе занимается продажей овощи и фрукты. Она продает помидоры, огурцы, болгарский, слива и персик. Мухаббат от этой деятельностью зарабатывает на жизнь. Он с утро до вечера проводит время на рынке, чтобы прокормить детей. Все родители так старается ради своих детей. Мухаббат планирует взять кредит и за счет кредита перевозить больше фрукты и овощи для расширения бизнеса. Она уверена в себе, что она станет успешным женщиной.
texts.en:
Muhabbat is 35 years old, and she is from the Rumy district. She is married and is the mother of two children. Her children are young, and go to kindergarten. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. Muhabbat works by selling fruits and vegetables in her district. She sells tomatoes, cucumbers, bell peppers, plums, and peaches.

Muhabbat makes enough money from this business to live. She works from morning until evening in the market so that she can feed her children. All parents work like this for their children. Muhabbat plans to take out a loan and, with this money, transport more fruits and vegetables to expand her business. She is confident that she will become a successful woman.

loans.use: to transport fruits and vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Damas Valientes Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este grupo se formaron en Ciudad del Este, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, con el anhelo de que, a través del trabajo unido de todas, y sumado a las capacitaciones podrán ir mejorando.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dulcina es una de ellas, quien se destaca por ser siempre una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora que quiere ayudar a su familia y a sus compañeras dentro del grupo. Ella vende calzados, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ir mejorando cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar calzados variados, ya que se acerca la temporada de invierno y quiere poder tener una buena variedad que poder dar a sus clientes.
En la foto aparecen 17 mujeres, ya que el grupo tiene ese numero de miembros, pero solo 16 piden este préstamo.
texts.en:
The members of this group got together in Ciudad del Este. They are part of the poverty elimination program. They hope that through their combined hard work and collective abilities they will be able to improve.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Dulcina.  She is known for being an optimistic hard-working woman who wants to help her family and her partners in the group. She sells shoes, and with this work she has the means to keep improving each day. 

She is seeking a loan to buy a variety of shoes since the winter season is approaching and she wants to have a good selection to offer her clients.
In the photograph there are 17 women, since that is how many women are in the group, but only 16 are seeking this loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy three bags of rice, one container of cooking oil, 225 kilos of sugar, 25 bags of fine salt, and one box of soap.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
Véronique est une femme dynamique de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et son mari travaille en tant que chauffeur dans une petite entreprise individuelle. Ils ont quatre enfants âgés de 10, 9, 6 et 2 ans; les trois premiers suivent leurs études en primaire dans une école privée pas très loin de leur domicile.
Véronique vend des vêtements fripes et des chaussures à l'occasion depuis 2012. Auparavant, elle dirigeait une petite épicerie mais en trouvant que les profits étaient faibles, et que les concurrents devenaient de plus en plus durs, elle décidait de changer d'activité.
Grâce à leurs efforts (elle et son mari) et leurs ambitions, son commerce et leur ménage commencent à s'améliorer petit à petit. Son objectif est de devenir grossiste en friperie et en chaussure à l'occasion.
texts.en:
Véronique is a dynamic 32-year-old woman. She is married and her husband works as a driver for a small individual business. They have four children aged ten, nine, six, and two. The oldest three are getting a primary education at a private school not very far from their house.

Véronique has been selling second-hand clothes and shoes since 2012. Before this, she used to manage a small grocery store, but finding the profits low and the competitors ever more aggressive, she decided to switch businesses.

Thanks to her and husband’s efforts and ambitions, her business and their household are slowly doing better. Her objective is to become a wholesaler of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to buy one bundle of second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em quelimane tem 51 anos de idade, solteira mãe de 3 filhos apenas 1 é menor de idade e frequenta a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua neta que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2011. Pois para terminar a sua obra de dependências solicita o seu 4º empréstimo na Hluvuku para adquirir material de construção como: areia, cimento, chapas e barrotes.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua de residência e iniciar o muro de vedação da sua residência.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Quelimane, Mozambique and is 51 years old. She is a single mother to three children, only one of whom is still in school, and she also cares for a granddaughter who lives with her.

Maria started working with Hluvuku in 2011. She is asking for her fourth loan in order to finish construction of rental properties by acquiring construction materials like sand, cement, zinc plates, and metal bars. In the future, Maria plans to finish construction of her own house and to begin to build a wall around it for privacy.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, zinc plates, and metal bars.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Maputo tem 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 2 filhos menores de idade, apenas 1 frequenta a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É negociante e solicita o seu 1º empréstimo na Hluvuku para aumentar o volume do seu negócio de criação de frangos adquirindo pintos, ração e vitaminas.
Futuramente pretende abrir um salão de beleza e dar continuidade com os seus estudos.
O seu maior desafio é expandir mais no seu negócio de criação frangos.
texts.en:
Ilda was born in Maputo and is 28 years old. She is married and has two young children, only one of whom is in school, and she is not financially responsible for anyone besides her family.

Ilda runs a business raising chickens and she is asking for her first loan from Hluvuku in order to expand her business by buying chicks, feed, and vitamins. In the future she would like to open a beauty salon and continue with her studies. Her main goal right now is to see her business expand.

loans.use: buy chicks, feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools and inputs for use on the farm, for high production and supply for more income gain.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a farmer and salesperson from North Rift Kenya. He practices small-scale dairy and crop farming on his farm. His main income sources are milk and cereals. He makes extra money through commission on the sale of cereal grains that he aggregates from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers.

Since he is a broker, Charles can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers. Therefore, he prefers to stock a large volume of cereal produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers. Using his understanding of the market conditions and prices, he will sell the produce at a better price.

Income from this investment will help Charles generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Goharik

texts.en: Goharik is 60 years old. She is widowed and lives in Borjomi with her son. She is a pensioner and seasonally rents out a flat for tourists and generates some income. Goharik requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan to purchase a car. After the car is purchased, her son will serve locals as a taxi driver and will generate stable income. Goharic hopes that the taxi business will be profitable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a car, after which her son will serve locals as a taxi driver

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en:
Janifer is 45 years old, and she supports four children.

She has been selling animal drugs and feed in the market for 17 years, and the business earns her KES 12,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase stock of animal feed for sale.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate her children. She hopes to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to purchase stock of animal feed for sale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Moamba Província de Maputo tem 60 anos de idade é viúva, mãe de 5 filhos maiores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
É doméstica pois recebe a pensão do falecido marido que aplica nas despesas da sua casa e na obra. Com este empréstimo pretende dar continuidade com a construção do seu muro de vedação na sua residência adquirindo material de construção como: areia, cimento e blocos. Este é o seu 6º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende ampliar as suas dependências para aluguer. O seu maior desafio é da deslocação de Namaacha a Boane para aquisição de material de construção por lá ser mais acessível.
texts.en:
Maria was born in Moamba in the province of Maputo. She is 60 years old and is a widow. She has five grown children, all of whom are currently studying, and she is not financially responsible for anyone else.

Maria works as a housekeeper and receives a pension on the part of her late husband, which she uses to cover household expenses and also to pay for her current construction project. With this loan Maria would like to continue with the construction of a privacy wall on her property by acquiring construction materials like sand, cement, and blocks. This is her sixth loan with Hluvuku.

In the future Maria would like to expand outbuildings on her property in order to rent them out. Her main challenge has been having to travel from Namaacha to Boane in order to buy construction materials, because they are more readily available there.

loans.use: buy sand, cement, and blocks.

loans.name: Amilcar

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha Província de Maputo tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de gémeos menores de idade, responsabiliza-se pela sua sobrinha que vive em sua casa.
É docente N4 a mais de 6 anos e é negociante de produtos de beleza, ganha um valor que aplica nas despesas da sua casa. Com o empréstimo solicitado pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo diversos tipos de cabelos. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo na Hluvuku.
Futuramente pretende abrir uma empresa de consultoria e terminar com os seus estudos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
Amilcar was born in Namaacha in the province of Maputo. He is 30 years old, married, and is the father of two young twins. He also helps care for a niece who lives with his family.

For more than six years Amilcar has worked as a teacher and also selling beauty products. He uses his earnings to cover household expenses. With the current loan he plans to raise his sales volume by acquiring a variety of types of hair extensions. This is his third loan with Hluvuku.

In the future, Amilcar would like to open a counseling service and finish with his college education.

loans.use: buy a variety of hair extensions.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 29 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past five years, Richard has been working hard to manage the electrical shop which he owns, where he sells television sets, power cables and other items. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock television sets and mobile phones that will increase his sales and provide enough basic needs for the family. It will also help Richard to generate greater profits and have a better life with his family. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to own another business of the same kind. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock television sets and mobile phones that will increase his sales and provide enough basic needs for the family,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of sodas for sale to clients. This will help him meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 28 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her salon / hair dressing business. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more hair dressing items like braids and hair relaxers. This will attract more customers and increase her profits, which will improve her family's standard of living. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business and shift it to the center of town. 

Esther is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Esther who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock more hair dressing items like braids and hair relaxers. This will attract more customers and increase her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her productivity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wheelbarrows for transporting bricks to the nearest construction sites for sale. This will help him make more income to support his family.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 45 years old and she supports three children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 12 years and the business earns her KES 9,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest for family use. She will sell the surplus produce in the market to clients.

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and educate her child.

Her hopes are to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest for family use. She will sell the surplus produce in the market to clients.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of clothes for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Twekambe Mixed Farmers Kayanja Group

texts.en:
Sepiriano is a married Ugandan male aged 54 years living in Kagadi Uganda with 6 children aged between 29 and 13 years. He operates a liquor business where he sells local brew commonly known as waragi and he also earns from crop growing. He plans to construct his residential house and educate his four children who are still in school. 

Sepiriano has requested a loan to buy local brew for resale. He is a member of Twekambe Mixed farmers group where members guarantee each other to access a loan as they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy more local brew (waragi) for selling

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 48 years old and lives in the town of Rbibndi in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Nathan has been working hard to manage his farm business, where he rears cattle and sales milk. 

To help expand his business, Nathan has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase enough tools that will help him in milking the cows and a car for transporting the milk in different places, and will help Nathan to generate greater profits and improving more on his farming business seeing that he can manage to produce more milk for his customers. Nathan hopes that in the future he will be able to improving his business to increase on his sales. 

Nathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase enough tools that will help him in milking the caws and a car for transporting the milk in different places,

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is a 24-year-old mother of one living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. To help her community, she conducts life skills education classes. In addition to being a community role model, using her $500 loan she expanded her poultry business. 

Blessing’s business is doing well. She want to further expand her poultry business. With this investment in her business, her profits will increase, and she will be able to care for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens, drugs and vaccines.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 32 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Thomas has been working hard to manage his bar business, which he owns a bar that sells beers, wine and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Thomas has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase enough crates of beer and soda to increase the stock, hence attracting more customers and will help Thomas to generate greater profits and be working hard to see that he can manage to take his kids to better schools and giving them a better life. Thomas hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger bar in town. 

Thomas is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Thomas who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase enough crates of beer and soda to increase on the stock hence attracting more customers,

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillianis 36 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, she has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which she sells news clothes. 

To help expand her business, Lillian has requested a loan of 4500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy the clothes that will increase her profits so as to pay some of her kids medication bills and will help her to generate greater profits and expanding her business into a bigger boutique. She hopes that in the future she will be able to operate a bigger shopping mall of her own. 

Lillian is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like LILLIAN who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy the clothes that will increase her profits more so as to pay some of her kids medication bills

loans.name: Isaa

texts.en:
Isaa is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Isaa has been working hard to manage his charcoal business, where he manages a business of charcoal selling. 

To help expand his business, Isaa has requested a loan of 4000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock enough sacks of charcoal to increase more sales, and will help Isaa to generate greater profits and improving more on his profits and also taking good care of his family. Isaa hopes that in the future he will be able to open up other jointe that sale charcoal.

Isaa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Isaa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock enough sacks of charcoal to increase more sales,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of baking flour for making mandazi and chapati for sale to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 39 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rebecca has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which she manages to sale plastic items, sugar and soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Rebecca has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase on her stock and buy more soft drinks to be sold at her convenience store, and will help Rebecca to generate greater profits and to stock more items in her store that will increase her sales and manage to take her children in better schools. Rebecca hopes that in the future she will be able to change her business into a whole sale shop. 

Rebecca is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rebecca who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase on her stock and buy more soft drinks to be sold at her convenience store,

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como ama de casa,la socia es una mujer emprededora y trabajadora que por medio dee ste negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cocina para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is still dedicated to being a homemaker. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman who wants to provide for her family. The member is requesting a loan to purchase a kitchen for her house. 

The member is happy with this loan and promises to  make her payments.

loans.use: purchase a kitchen for her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new machine and oils for use so as to attract more clients to gain more income.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Doña Magaly Medina  tiene 45 años, es vecina de la comunidad de Guatuso de Patarra, cuenta con un negocio de pulpería  denominado "Santa Eduvigues", ella es una mujer trabajadora y con deseos de prosperar, madre de dos hijos, uno de ellos esta actualmente trabajando y la otra ayuda en el negocio. La Sra. Medina cuenta con 24 años de tener la pulperia, vende productos como abarrotes, granos, productos lácteos entre otros, este negocio lo adquirió  luego de que su suegro se la entregara como herencia a sus nietos y a ella. Para el desarrollo de su pulpería, cuenta con tres urnas en buen estado, tres cámaras de refrigeración dadas en las empresas comerciales, así como una góndola de pared para exhibir la mercadería. 
Cuenta con un mercado durante 12 meses al año, ya que vive en un vecindario muy populoso que atiende con los productos que vende. Para diferenciarse de la competencia compra artículos de fontanería, tales como tubo, uniones, pegamentos, lijas, llave de chorro entre otros, ya que muchos de sus clientes solicitan estos artículos y al no existir una ferretería cercana se convierte la venta en una opción para mejorar la competencia. Asimismo incluiría artículos escolares y de librería, para que el negocio sea mas completo.
texts.en:
Magaly Medina is 45 years old. She is a resident of the Guatuso de Patarra community. She has a grocery store named Santa Eduvigues. She is a hard working woman with dreams of success. She is mother to two children. One of them is currently working and the other helps with the business. Mrs. Medina has had the grocery store for 24 years. She sells products such as groceries, grains and milk products, among others. She acquired this business after her father in law passed it down as an inheritance to his grandchildren and to her. For developing her grocery store she has three storage cases in good shape and three cooling chambers from commercial businesses as well as shelving for displaying the merchandise.

There is a marketplace she attends with the products she sells during the 12 months of the year since she lives in a very populated neighborhood. To differentiate herself from the competition she purchases plumbing items such as piping, coupling, glue, sandpaper and faucets, among others. Since many of her customers request these items and there is not a hardware store nearby, she transforms her business into an option to beat the competition. Additionally, she will include school supplies and books so that the business is more complete.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase milk, molds, and all the tools for her making products.

loans.name: Ariel Wilfredo

texts.es: Ariel tiene 22 años de edad habita en casa familiar junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad. Él presta sus servicios como motorista de transporte en una empresa privada muy reconocida desde hace 8 años y es de esa forma que él lleva el sustento a su familia. Ariel se preocupa porque la época de invierno ya está cerca y el techo de su vivienda está bastante deteriorado y se le filtra el agua lluvia por lo que está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: láminas, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y brindar protección  a su familia.
texts.en: Ariel is 22 years old. He lives in a family home with his wife and his little one-year-old daughter. He has been a driver for a well known private company for eight years. He is able to support his family. Ariel is worried about the upcoming winter. His home's roof is deteriorating and lets rainwater through. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to purchase sheeting, wood and nails to change the house's roof and bring his family protection.

loans.use: purchase sheeting, wood and nails to change his roof

loans.name: Veronica Judith

texts.es:
Verónica Judith tiene 33 años de edad,soltera, sin hijos,vive con su familia en una zona rural en el Centro poblado Nueva Arica, en el distrito de Cayaltí, que pertenece a la Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, costa Norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza por unidades y cajas, con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio,el cual está ubicado en su misma casa. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más envases y cajas de cervezas para aumentar su stock , esto le ayudará en la implementacion de su negocio para asi poder dar un buen servicio a los consumidores. Varonica con esto piensa hacer crecer su negocio, generar mayores ingresos de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Verónica Judith is 33 years old and single with no children.  She lives with her family in a rural zone in the village Nueva Arica, in the district of Cayaltí which belongs to the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the coast north of Peru.  

She sells beer by the bottle and case, with more than 2 years experience in the business which is located in her home.  She is requesting a loan to buy more bottles and cases of beer to increase her stock.  This will help in the running of her business and enable her to provide good service to her customers.  With this loan Verónica is looking to grow her business, generate greater income and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more bottles and cases of beer to increase her stock

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
Pascuala  es una mujer digna de admirarse porque trabaja de sol a sol en los verdes campos con cultivos de café y banano, ella cuenta que gracias a su primer crédito logro realizar la inversión en su venta de banano y de almácigos y afortunadamente le género muy buenas de ganancias con la que pudo comprar una mugada de ropa típica que mucha falta le hacía, ahora Pascuala viendo las necesidades que tiene a tomado la decisión de solicitar un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar una cuerda de terreno cultivable.
Pascuala tiene las esperanzas de contar con este nuevo crédito para poder adquirir el terreno y construir su casa de block.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a dignified woman to be admired as she works from sun up to sun down in the green fields of coffee and banana plantations.  She says that thanks to her first loan she was able to invest in her banana sales and coffee seedlings.  Fortunately this generated sufficient income with which she was able to buy an outfit of typical clothing which she was in great need of.  

In view of her current needs, Pascuala has made the decision to request a new loan to buy a plot of arable land.  Pascuala hopes to obtain this loan to acquire the land and build a block house.

loans.use: to buy a plot of arable land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in spare parts for bicycles, such as tires, helmets, pedals, brakes, chains, etc.

loans.name: Nizom

texts.ru: Этого мужчину зовут Низом. Ему 28 лет. Он примерный семянин. Низом живет вместе с семьей в городке Исфара. Он работает в мельнице. Низом чувтвует большую ответственность за свою семью. Он должен обеспечить семью и быть опорой для них. На данный момент брат Низома болеет и находится в больнице. Низому необходимо купить лекарства и оплатить лечение. На все это уйдут средства. Низом не имеет таких средств и обратился за кредитом. Поддержите его.
texts.en:
This 28 year old man is named Nizom.  He lives with his family in the city of Isfara where he works in a flour mill.  He is an exemplary family man.  Nizom feels a strong responsibility for his family members and considers it his duty to provide for them and to be a source of strength for them.  

Currently, his brother is ill and is in the hospital.  Nizom has to buy medicines and pay for the medical treatment.  All of this requires financial means, the likes of which Nizom does not have.  So he has applied for a loan.  Please support him!

loans.use: to pay for his brother's medical treatment

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.ru: Абдурасул один из жителей района Чиликул. Он в районе занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Абдурасул имеет большой земельный участок. Он посадил кукурузу и помидоры.
