Абдурасул имеет только одну деятельность, который приносят ему больше доход, это земледелие. Он больше времени проводит на земле. Ему в работе помогает сыновья. Жена тоже занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. Абдурасул и его семья трудолюбивые люди. Он должен обработать землю минеральными удобрениями. Для купли минеральных удобрений у него не хватает денежных средств. И он решил взять кредит. Абдурасул надеется, что он может собирать достаточную сумму денег. Поддержите его!
texts.en:
Abdurasul is a resident of the Jilikul region.  He is in the farming business.  Abdurasul has a large plot of land where he has planted corn and tomatoes.  His only work is his farming business and it brings him a good income.  Abdurasul spends most of his time in the field.  His wife and sons help him in his work.  

Abdurasul has to fertilize his land but he does not have sufficient funds to buy the mineral fertilizers, so he has decided to take out a loan.  Abdurasul hopes that he will be able to come up with enough money. Please support him!

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Shukrani Group

texts.fr: Kalima est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Shukrani», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 35 ans, mère 8 enfants dont 3 étudient et 5 autres n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse des braises dans un marché de la périphérie de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu d'un crédit. Elle va s’approvisionner en 7 sacs de braises. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons a signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Kalima is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Shukrani”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 35 years old and the married mother of eight children, of whom three are students, and five others are not. 

Kalima has been a vendor of charcoal at a suburban market for six years. She started her business with  funds from a loan. She is going to stock up with 7 sacks of charcoal. She would like to build a house and provide schooling and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs. We really want to indicate that certain clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to stock up with 7 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Feruzakhon

texts.ru:
Ферузахон добрая, любящая жена и ответственная мама. Ей 38 лет. На плечах этой сильной женщины дом, работа и дети. Ферузахон имеет двоих малолетних детей и вместе с детьми живет в городке Турсунзаде. Муж Ферузы находится на заработках заграницей. Феруза дома занимается шитьем женской одежды и в основном за счет своих услуг она покрывает расходы семьи. 
  Причина обращения за кредитом со стороны Ферузахона является ремонт жилища. Она просит кредит, чтобы отремонтировать дом который давно нуждается в ремонтных работах. Ее капитал не позволяют ей купить стройматериалы и она надеется только на получения кредита.
texts.en:
Feruzakhon is 38 years old and a kind and loving wife and responsible mother.  She lives in Tursun-zoda with her two minor children.  Her husband works abroad.  Her home, her work, and her children all rest on her strong shoulders.  Feruzakhon works from home sewing women's clothing and covers her family's primary expenses with her earnings.

Feruzakhon's reason for applying for a loan is so that she can do home repairs.  She is requesting the loan so that she can do repairs that her home has long needed.  Her savings are not enough to allow her to buy building materials and her only hope is to receive a loan.

loans.use: to repair her home

loans.name: La Clémence Group

texts.fr: Lutala est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédit «La Clémence», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 56 ans, mère de 3 enfants qui ont déjà fini leurs études. Elle est vendeuse des friperies à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari, lors de son vivant. Elle va acheter des sacs à main. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Lutala is a merchant and a member of the loan group “La Clémence”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 56 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children, who have already finished their studies. 

Lutala has been a vendor of secondhand goods for five years at her home on a busy avenue in town. She started her business with funds from her husband when he was alive. She is going to purchase some handbags. Thus, her wish is to build a house and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase handbags

loans.name: Rio Grande Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “RIO GRANDE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Santa Ana, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convencion y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rose Mery ella es conviviente y tiene 33 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de agricultura, la socia tiene un terreno donde cultiva café, plátanos y cacao, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tambien se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como gallinas y patos,la socia los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y semillas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo y tambien sale agachada porque la socia es timida y no queria mirar la camara.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These communal bank members belong to the "Rio Grande" communal bank. This bank is located in the Santa Ana district, which belongs to the La Convención province and the department of Cusco.

One of the members is Señora Rose Mery. She live with her partner, and she is 33 years old and has 2 children. She works in her agriculture business. She has a plot of land where she raises coffee, bananas, and cacao. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She also works in her business of raising animals such as chickens and ducks. She sells them at various markets. She has already been in this business for 5 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand the plot of land she cultivates. She is applying for the loan to buy fertilizers and seeds.

The photograph of one member is attached to the group photo. The photo was taken after the meeting because she asked permission for work reasons, and also her head is bowed because she is timid and didn't want to look at the camera.

The other members work in businesses of selling candies, selling clothing, a grocery store, and a restaurant.

This communal bank member is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make the payments on her account on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Nadira

texts.ru: Надира, 34 года, не замужем, дочери полтора года. В 2010 году, начала бизнес по реализации продуктов питания и товаров широкого потребления в арендованном магазине. На сегодняшний день ее среднемесячный доход составляет до 22,000 сом (KGS). Надира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров для расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита позволят Надире развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en:
Nadira is 34 years old and not married.  She has an 18 month old daughter.  In 2010, she started a business selling groceries and consumer goods in a rented store.  Today, her average monthly income is as much as 22,000 som (KGS).  

Nadira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy goods to expand the assortment of goods she offers for sale.  The profits from the loan will allow Nadira to develop her business and to improve her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to increase turnover of products in her shop, to help bolster her income

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to stock up on peanuts, oil, and tomatoes

loans.name: Oysha

texts.ru:
Ойша сильная и смелая женщина, пережившая на своем пути многое. В жизни Ойши было много падений, но благодаря вере в Бога и в себя она преодолевала преграды на своем пути. Ойша смогла воспитать и поставить на ноги двоих сыновей. Сейчас ее сыновья для нее опора и поддержка.
  Ойша более 5 лет занимается шитьем одежды на заказ. Она любит свою работу и хочет продолжить свою деятельность. Ойша обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить новую машинку, так как старая совсем устарела. Она надеется, что с заемными средствами она приобретет машинку и продолжить деятельность.
texts.en:
Oysha is a strong and daring woman who has lived through a lot in her life.  There have been many let-downs, but thanks to her faith in God and in herself, Oysha has been able to overcome the obstacles in her path.  Oysha managed to raise her sons and get them standing on their own two legs.  Now her sons are Oysha's help and support.

For more than five years, Oysha has been in business sewing clothes to order. She loves her work and wants to continue it.  She has applied for a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine since her current one is quite old and worn out.  Oysha is hoping that with the loan, she will acquire a sewing machine and continue her work.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es: Edilberto de 25 años de edad quien habita en vivienda familiar en compañía de su esposa e hijo de un 1 año de edad y su padre. Él es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia ha venido sacando adelante a su familia Edilberto presta sus servicios en un hotel cerca de la zona donde él vive, además se dedica al cultivo de maíz y plátanos y desea poder mejorar sus cultivos para obtener un mayor ingreso así poder darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: abono, herbicidas y pago de apoyo para cultivo de maíz y plátanos.
texts.en: Edilberto, who is 25 years old, lives in the family home in the company of his wife, a 1-year-old son, and his father. He is a very hard-working person who with much effort and perseverance has been raising his family. Edilberto offers his services in a hotel near the zone where he lives. In addition, he raises corn and bananas, and he wants to be able to improve his crops in order to obtain better income and thus be able to give a better quality of life to his family. It is for this reason that he is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in compost and herbicides and pay for labor for his corn and banana crops.

loans.use: to invest in compost and herbicides and pay for labor for his corn and banana crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of animals for fattening and subsequent sale.

loans.name: Ujumbe Group

texts.fr: Sulemani est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Ujumbe», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un maçon, âgée de 31 ans, mère 5 enfants dont 2 étudient et 3 sont gosses. Elle est propriétaire d’une quincaillerie et  vendeuse des matériaux de construction sur une route secondaire de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter un carton de vernis. Elle souhaite accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Sulemani is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Ujumbe”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is 31 years old and married to a mason. The mother of five children, of whom two are students, and three are very young, she has been the owner of a hardware store for three years and sells construction supplies and equipment on a secondary road in town. She began her business with funds from her husband. 

Sulemani is going to purchase a box of varnish. Her wish is to grow her sales and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase a box of varnish

loans.name: Khayridin

texts.ru: Хайридин 33 летный муж и отец. У него трое детей. Жена занимается животноводством. Дети помогает ей в работе. Хайриддин дома занимается сварщиком. Он более 3 лет занимается своим бизнесом. Хайриддин соединяет металлических частей путем сварки. Еще он производит угольные и дровяные печки из металлических бочек.  Хайридину идет по стопам отца, потому что его отец тоже занимался этой сфере деятельностью. Он хочет приобрести оборудование для расширения бизнеса. Хайриддин надеется путем купли оборудования у него облегчиться работа и увеличиться доход. Он верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Khayridin is 33 years old.  He is a husband and father of three children.  His wife is in the animal husbandry business and their children help her with her work.  Khayridin works from home as a welder and has been in this business for over three years.  Khayridin also makes coal- and wood-fired heaters from metal barrels.  He wants to buy equipment to expand his business.  He is hoping that by buying equipment, his work will become easier and that his income will increase.  He believes in you and in your support.

loans.use: to buy equipment for business expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in: laminate, cement, iron, sand and beams to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Mulangane Group

texts.fr: Kishala est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Mulangane», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un commerçant, âgée de 27 ans, mère 4 enfants  tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des oignons dans un marché de la place depuis 4 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en 80 kg d’oignons. Elle souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaires, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler qu’une cliente porte son  bébé.
texts.en:
Kishala is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Mulangane”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married to a merchant. She is 27 years old and the mother of four children, all in school. Kishala has been a vendor of onions at a local market for four years. She began her business with funds from her husband. 

She is going to stock up with 80 kg of onions. Her wish is to increase her sales and provide schooling and food for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs. We want very much to indicate that a client is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to stock up with 80 kg of onions

loans.name: Les Chérubins Group

texts.fr: Fatuma est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Les Chérubins», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un maçon, âgée de 42 ans, mère 6 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle est propriétaire d’un restaurant sur la route principale de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter 5kg de viandes, 10 kg de poissons, etc. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Fatuma is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Les Chérubins”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is married to a mason. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children, all in school. She has been the owner  of a restaurant on the main road in town for two years. She began her business with funds from her husband. 

Fatuma is going to purchase 5 kg of meat, 10 kg of fish, etc. Her wish is to grow her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 5 kg of meat, 10 kg of fish, etc. for her restaurant

loans.name: Muazamkhon

texts.ru:
Муазамхон 38 летняя жительница района Руми. Она разведена с мужем и одна воспитывает троих детей. Ее старший ребенок скоро окончит среднюю школу и двое младших еще продолжат учебу в общеобразовательной школе. Муазамхон работает столовой и этим зарабатывает себе и детям на жизнь. 
В семье Муаззамхон произошла трагедия. Брат Муазамхон скончался. Для ее семьи это стала большой трагедией. Муазамхон скорбит по-своему брату и теперь ей нужно провести поминки в его честь. Для проведения похоронных мероприятий она обратилась за кредитом, с надеждой на поддержку.
texts.en:
Muazamkhon is 38 years old and a resident of the J.Rumy region.  She is divorced from her husband and is raising her three children alone.  Her eldest child will soon finish secondary school.  Her youngest children are still in grammar school.  Muazamkhon works in a cafeteria and in this way supports herself and her children.

There has been a tragedy in Muazamkhon's family.  Her brother died.  This was a terrible tragedy for her family. Muazamkhon is mourning her brother and now she must hold the funeral banquet.  It is with hope for support that she has applied for a loan in order to do so.

loans.use: to hold a funeral banquet

loans.name: Amkeni Group

texts.fr: Georgette est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Amkeni», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée a un agent de l’ordre, âgée de 32 ans, mère 6 enfants  dont 5 étudient et 1 encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse de divers habits  usagés sur la rue mouvementée de la ville depuis 12 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va s’approvisionner en un ballon de friperies. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Georgette is a merchant and a member of the 'banc villageois' called “Amkeni”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is woman married to a police representative. She is 32 years old and the mother of six children (5 students and one who is very young). Georgette has been a vendor of a variety of used clothing on a busy street in town for twelve years. She began her business with funds from her husband. 

She is going to stock up on a bale of secondhand clothing. Her wish is to grow her capital and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up with a bale of secondhand clothing

loans.name: Oscar Oliberto

texts.es: Oscar de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia su compañera de vida, el posee un carwash desde hace 7 años su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes por su buen trabajo, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de shampoo, detergente, aromas y reparación de maquina aspiradora para continuar con trabajo ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Oscar is 34 years old. He lives in his own house with his partner. He has owned a car wash for 7 years. His business is located at his house and he has a lot of customers because of the good work he does. With his profits he is able to get ahead. He is requesting a loan in order to buy car shampoo, detergent, car scents, and to repair a vacuum so that he can continue working, as this is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy car shampoo, detergent, car scents, and to repair a vacuum.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Elizabeth se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Elizabeth sells food for living. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soup, and stir fry meat. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. She now has 8 years of experience in this business, and it is going very well. Her dream is to have a restaurant. 

The member is requesting for a loan to purchase ingredients with cook with, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken. She is happy about the loan and commits to completing the due payments.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to cook with, such as rice, vegetables, and chicken

loans.name: Buguma Kulyanwa Ii Group

texts.fr: Kajinaki a plus de 20 ans d'expérience dans la riziculture. Il l'a hérité de ses parents. Malgré ses moyens limités, la rentabilité de cette activité lui permet de répondre comme il le peut aux besoins familiaux. Il compte  travailler beaucoup et davantage afin d'avoir  une bonne production qui lui permettra d'améliorer sa vie au quotidien. Président du groupe Buguma kulyanwa II, il tient sur la photo, un carnet rose.
texts.en: Kajinaki has over 20 years of experience in rice farming. His parents passed it down to him. Despite his limited means, the profitability of this business enables him to respond as much as he can to family needs. He intends to do a lot more work to have a good harvest, enabling him to improve his day-to-day life. The president of the group “Buguma kulyanwa II”, he is the one holding a pink booklet in the photo.

loans.use: to pay for plant care products and manual labor for transplanting and weeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her productivity.

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer honrada y trabajadora, que se ha abierto paso en el mundo por si sola y ha sacado adelante a sus cinco hijos. Ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzado ambulante, el cual ha logrado mantener en pie y siempre abastecido de mercadería variada. Con este negocio ha logrado mejorar notablemente su calidad de vida. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para mejorar su baño, el cual con mucho esfuerzo ha ido construyendo, sin embargo por las fuertes lluvias su construcción se echó a perder. Esta es una prioridad porque pone en riesgo su higiene y por ende su salud. Esta mujer pretende seguir trabajando con Kiva y MiCrédito, en un futuro se ve siendo propietaria de una tienda de calzado y ropa.
texts.en:
Claudia is an honorable and hardworking person who has gotten ahead in the world on her own and has helped her five children get ahead as well. She has a business selling shoes as a street seller, which she has managed to keep going and stocked with a variety of merchandise. With this job she has notably improved her quality of life. 

She is requesting a loan in order to improve her bathroom, which she has been working hard to build. However, due to some strong rains, what she had built was lost. This is a priority for her because this puts her hygiene in danger, and therefore her heath. She intends to continue working with Kiva and MiCrédito. In the future, she sees herself being the owner of a shoe and clothing store.

loans.use: to improve her bathroom.

loans.name: Wendlamanegda Group

texts.fr: Salamata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait le commerce du céréales depuis 8 ans. Salamata et son groupe sont à leur 4ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et les remboursements se font à la bonne date. Le groupe est formé de femme battante qui font le commerce. Salamata à besoin du crédit pour acheter du mil et du haricot pour vendre. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire les dépenses de sa famille et aussi continuer son activité.
texts.en: Salamata, the representative member, is a married mother of six. She has been doing commerce in grains for eight years. She and her group are on their 4th loan contract with ACFIME, and the payments were made on time. The group is composed of determined women working in commerce. Salamata has needs of the loan to purchase some millet and beans to sell. After the sales, she will have a profit enabling her to cover family expenses and also to continue her business.

loans.use: to purchase millet and beans to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old, married to Richard, and supports 5 children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 19 years, earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Florence has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy new digging and slashing hoes to be used in the farm. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy new equipment to use in her farming activities.

loans.name: Jeshi Kubwa Group

texts.fr: L'idée de pratiquer la riziculture est venue depuis l'an 2000 à la sortie de la guerre de 1998 qui a occasionné des pillages et le chômage dans le village. Aujourd'hui, cette activité permet à la famille de vivre et de répondre aux besoins sociaux, l'acquisition d'une parcelle et bien d'autres choses. Pourtant, Kyambalira réalise que les moyens sont insuffisants pour financer l'activité du labour à la transformation de produits, il pense que les crédits qu'il aura à bénéficier lui permettra d'élargir les superficies culturales  afin d'améliorer ses conditions de vie. Il préside le groupe JESHI KUBWA et tient sur la photo un carnet.
texts.en:
The idea of rice farming came in 2000 following the 1998 war, which caused the pillaging of villages and unemployment. Today, rice farming enables families to live and respond to societal needs, acquire parcels of land, and much more. 

However, Kyambalira realized that he could not afford the business costs, from processing to production. He thinks that the loans he obtains will enable him to expand his arable land, so as to improve his living conditions. Kyambalira presides over the group JESHI KUBWA and is the one in the photo holding a booklet.

loans.use: to maintain fields and pay for plant care products and fertilizer

loans.name: Ada

texts.es: Doña Ada de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica al  cultivo de maíz y maicillo posee 20 años de experiencia en la actividad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, ella  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumo fertilizantes, herbicidas e insecticida  todo por mayor y así tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en: Ada is 52 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband. She farms corn and sorghum and she has 20 years of experience in this business. She sells her products in various markets that are near her house. She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides, all at wholesale price so she can have the best possible income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, and insecticides, all at wholesale price.

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.fr: Balingene est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Yesu Anaweza», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée, âgée de 32 ans, mère de 7 enfants dont 3 sont scolarisés et 4 n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans une avenue animée de la ville depuis 5 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en braises, haricots et pommes de terre. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables
texts.en: Balingene is a merchant and a member of the community bank “Yesu Anaweza”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is a married woman, 32 years old, and the mother of seven children (3 in school and 4 not in school). Balingene has been a vendor of grocery items for five years in her home on a busy avenue in town. She is going to stock up on charcoal, beans, and potatoes. Her wish is to grow her business and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to stock up on charcoal, beans, and potatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of goods and products such as baking flour and cooking oil to sell to clients and to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a farmer and salesperson from the Nyamira area of Kenya, who keeps dairy cows and grows food crops on his farm. His main income sources are milk and cereals. He makes commission on sale of sacks of cereal grains, which he aggregates from local farmers and sells to his network of buyers. Since he started this business, he has learned how important it is to build strong relationships with the people he is in business with. 

Given that Samwel can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, he prefers to stock a large volume of produce. He is seeking a loan to buy more produce from local farmers. Using his understanding of the market conditions and prices, he will sell the produce at a better price.  Income from this investment will help Samwel generate enough income to meet his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts and pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) posee 27 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, comercializa sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y ya tiene clientes establecidos, el  está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, controles de plagas y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Jorge is 48 years old and lives in his own home with his wife.  He works cultivating basic grains (corn and beans) and has 27 years experience in agriculture.  He sells his produce in nearby towns and now has regular customers.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, pest control and to improve the land seen in the photograph to achieve better income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides, compost, pest control and improve the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add  stock of electronics to his business for resale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old, married to Peter, and supports a family of three children. She has been practicing farm sales in the market for the last five years earning KES 6,000 per month.

Grace has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy materials for shade construction to attract more clients for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. Her future hope is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy materials for shade construction to attract more clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Kalamo Group

texts.fr: Lwashirha est commerçante, membre  du groupe de crédits «Kalamo», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un mécanicien, âgée de 35 ans, mère 3 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est propriétaire d’une quincaillerie et  vendeuse des matériaux de construction sur une rue animée de la ville depuis 4 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter trois sacs de ciments. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Lwashirha is a merchant and a member of the loan group “Kalamo”. A client of the microfinance institution Hekima, she is a woman married to a mechanic. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, who are students. Lwashirha has been the owner of a hardware store for four years and sells construction supplies and equipment on a busy street in town. She began her business with funds from her husband. She is going to purchase 3 sacks of cement. Her wish is to purchase a parcel of land and provide schooling and food for her children. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for its support of unbanked entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of cement

loans.name: Ben-Ton Group

texts.fr: N’Tjimbéré est un agriculteur de 57 ans. Il est marié à 2 femmes. N’Tjimbéré a 11 enfants âgés de 25 à 3 ans. 2 de ses enfants vont à l’école. Ces enfants ayant grandi lui-même ne participe plus aux activités champêtres et exerce l’élevage ovin depuis plus de 11 ans. Le prêt RMCR lui  permet d’acheter plus de bœufs pour son élevage. Le profit gagné de la vente de ses animaux lui permet d’assurer les frais de condiments et les autres frais de la famille tels que cérémonie baptême, mariage et autres.
texts.en: N’Tjimbéré is a 57-year-old farmer. He is married and has two wives. He has eleven children, aged 3 to 25 years old. Two of his children go to school. With grown children, N’Tjimbéré no longer helps with field work and has been raising sheep for over eleven years. The RMCR loan is enabling him to purchase more animals for his livestock farming. The profit earned from the sales of the animals enables him to ensure the coverage of the cost of food and other family cost, such as baptism ceremonies, weddings, and more.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to sell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Habit dans le quartier d’Adakpamé, Akouvi est une femme au foyer avec son mari. Agée de 23 ans, Akouvi vend des spaghettis et des céréales en parcourant tout son quartier à la recherche de la clientèle. Grâce à son dynamisme et sa vivacité, Akouvi arrive à vendre ses produits et réaliser une rentabilité quotidienne. Akouvi s’approvisionne une fois par mois et demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de riz et des cartons de spaghettis. Grâce au bénéfice Akouvi souhaite soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en: Living with her husband in the Adakpamé district, Akouvi is a housewife who is 23 years old. She sells spaghetti and grains by going from district to district looking for customers. Thanks to her energy and vivacity, she manages to sell her products and make a profit each day. She gets her supplies once a month and is asking for this loan to purchase sacks of rice and boxes of spaghetti. With her profits, Akouvi would like to support her husband in covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of rice and 6 boxes of spaghetti

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans. Mère de trois enfants, Abla vit à Bè pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Abla vend des friperies dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Abla s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Abla sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des chemises et des  jupes qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité.
texts.en: Abla is a married woman, 45 years old, who is the mother of three. She lives in Bè to operate her business. To respond to the needs of her family, she sells secondhand clothing in the district by going door to door, so as to make an income. She gets her supplies three times a month at the market. Concerned about having a new inventory, Abla is asking for this loan to purchase shirts and skirts, which she will be able to sell and make a profit.

loans.use: to purchase 5 units of shirts and 8 units of skirts

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Agée de 63 ans, Akoua est une femme qui a un enfant à sa charge. Habitant à Bè, Akoua est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes. Akoua vend des charbons de bois et des céréales à la devanture de sa maison et réalise un revenu favorable. Akoua s’approvisionne au marché trois fois par mois. Akoua sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois, des bols de farine et d’arachide afin d’avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux besoins de son enfant.
texts.en: Akoua, aged 63, is a woman with a child to support. A resident of Bè, she is very energetic and active in ensuring day-to-day expenses are covered. She sells charcoal and grains in front of her house and makes a favorable income. She gets her supplies at the market three time a month. Akoua is requesting this micro-loan to purchase sacks of charcoal, tubs of flour, and tubs of peanuts, so as to have a good profit margin for supporting her child.

loans.use: to purchase 3 sacks of charcoal, 15 tubs of flour, and 10 tubs of peanuts

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Adjowa est une femme mariée et âgée de 63 ans vit à Bè avec dix enfants à sa charge. Adjowa s’évertue de mettre à disposition de son ménage sa contribution et vend des ignames dans son quartier et trouve une satisfaction du profit qu’elle tire. Adjowa s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci de répondre aux besoins de ses consommateurs, Adjowa nécessite ce crédit pour acheter des ignames afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: Adjowa is a married woman, aged 63, living in Bè with ten children to support. She makes every effort to help out her household and sells yams in her district. She is happy with the profit she makes. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Concerned about responding to customer needs, Adjowa needs this loan to purchase some yams in order to realize more profit and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase some yams

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme divorcée qui vit Bè avec ses deux enfants. Yawa travaille  activement pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Yawa vend des produits d’alimentations générales dans son quartier afin d’avoir son bénéfice. Yawa achète ses provisions deux fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier et demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de farine et des détergents et maximiser ainsi son revenu pour l’épanouissement de ses enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is a divorced woman living in Bè with her two children. She works actively for her children to thrive. To achieve her goals, she sells grocery items in her district to make an income. She purchases her provisions twice a month at a local district market and is asking for this loan to order tubs of flour and some detergent, thus to maximize her revenues for her children to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase 30 tubs of flour and 15 packets of detergent

loans.name: Kè-Yèrèyé Group

texts.fr: Saly, femme âgée de 35 ans, mariée à un paysan et mère de un garçon scolarisé, âgé 13 ans ; elle est la femme qui est assise sur la photo. Après  dix ans exercice dans son activité de commerce céréale (arachide décortiqué), elle est la trésorière du groupe. Dans un but précis elle  sollicité un prêt pour augmenter son stock d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur le marché de sa localité revend plus d’arachides décortiqués dans le même marché.  Elle réalise plus de profit en fin de supporter les frais scolaire de son garçon.
texts.en: Saly, aged 35, is a woman married to a peasant farmer. She is the mother of one boy, aged 13, who is in school. Saly is the woman sitting in the photo. After ten years of operating her grains business (shelled peanuts), she is the treasurer of the group. With a specific purpose, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock of peanuts. She gets her supplies from her town’s market and resells the shelled peanuts at the same market. She is making more profit to support her son’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of peanuts to resell

loans.name: Rimnooma Group

texts.fr: Aoua est la responsable de ce groupe formé de 2 membres qui font le commerce et qui se battent au quotidien pour assurer un avenir à leurs enfants. Aoua est mariée, mère de 6 enfants et âgée de 42 ans. Cette brave dame a déjà fait 22 ans dans la vente des condiments. Elle a besoin du prêt pour aller acheter les condiments dans les villages environnant au prix en gros pour revendre. Aoua est accueillante et vend ses condiments à bon prix, c'est ce qui fait sa force. Après ses ventes, avec son bénéfice, elle pourra contribuer aux dépenses de la famille et aussi assurer la continuité de son activité.
texts.en: Aoua is the official of this group composed of two members who work in commerce and who struggle each day to ensure their children’s future.  Aoua, aged 42, is a married mother of six children. This good and honest lady already has 22 years of experience selling condiments. She has need of a loan to go purchase the condiments from nearby villages at wholesale prices. She is very accommodating and resells her condiments at good prices, which is her strength. After the sales, she will be able to help cover family expenses with the profits made and also to ensure her business continues.

loans.use: to purchase condiments to sell (tomatoes, onions, eggplant, spices, ...) and some yams to sell

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Agée de 57 ans, Cécile est une femme mariée qui vit avec cinq enfants à Bè. Pour favoriser leur épanouissement, Cécile vend des pagnes qu’elle expose dans son quartier. Cécile réalise son gain grâce à cette activité et s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter des pièces de pagne, Cécile demande ce fonds pour favoriser sa commande et avoir une marge bénéficiaire qui l’aidera à mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Cécile, aged 57, is a married woman living with her five children in Bè. For her children to thrive, she sells 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa), which she displays in her neighborhood. She makes a profit, thanks to this business. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. To purchase lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth, Cécile is asking for these funds to put in an order and to have a profit margin, which will help her to do better at covering family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 7 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une femme mariée  qui vit à Adakpamé avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Ayoko est âgée de 33 ans et œuvre activement pour apporter sa contribution à l’épanouissement de sa famille. Ayoko vend des produits d’alimentation générale et trouve une épargne pour favoriser son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille. Ayoko s’approvisionne deux fois par mois marché. Dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfice, Ayoko demande ce crédit pour acheter des laitues et des carottes.
texts.en: Ayoko is a married woman living in Adakpamé with four children to support. She is 33 years old and works actively helping her family to thrive. She sells grocery items and saves money to benefit her husband in covering family expenses. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market.  With the goal of making more profit, Ayoko is asking for this loan to purchase some lettuce and carrots.

loans.use: to purchase 4 units of lettuce and 100 units of carrots

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr: Kadia Founé est membre du groupe Benkadi, veuve et mère de  3 enfants âgée, de 4 à21 ans, elle est analphabète, réside  au Mali, âgés de 49 ans c’est elle qui tient la calebasse en main. Elle fait le commerce des céréales et les feuilles de Baobab. Les rêves et les espoirs de Kadia Founé est d’avoir plus d’argent pour acheter beaucoup de céréale, après ses vent de tirer plus de bénéfice pour subvenir aux besoins familiale. Par manque de moyen financier elle fait recourt au RMCR pour pouvoir mener son activité a plein temps. Elle s'approvisionne dans les foires hebdomadaires de sa zone et revend dans les villes. Elle  gagne comme bénéfice 15 000 FCFA par mois.Le prêt l’aidera à survenir aux besoins de sa famille : santé, scolaire etc., depuis 4 ans elle fait le commerce de céréale. Les obstacles auxquels se heurte Kadia Founé est souvent la chute des prix.
texts.en:
Kadia Founé is a member of the group Benkadi. A widow and the mother of three children, aged 4 to 21, she is illiterate and living in Mali. and she is 49 years old. She is the one in the photo holding a calabash. She does commerce in grains and baobab leaves. Kadia’s dreams and hopes include having more money to purchase a lot of grain after her sales and to make a profit for meeting family needs. 

Due to a lack of means, she turned to RMCR to be able to carry out her work in time. She gets her supplies from the weekly market in her area and resells in cities. She earns a profit of 15,000 francs per month. The loan will help her to meet family expenses: healthcare, schooling, etc. She has been in the grains business for four years. The obstacles she encounters include frequent drops in prices.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of grains to sell

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 26-year-old farmer from Kapsowar area of Kenya. He has been doing farming since he was very young. He enjoys dairy farming in particular, because he gets milk daily that provides him with food and income for his family. He practices crop farming too but expensive inputs and unpredictable weather are the major challenges associated with it.

This season, Jacob wants to to grow more crops on his farm. To achieve this, he needs external financing to buy modern agricultural inputs. That is the reason he applied for a loan from Kiva through Juhudi Kilimo.

With your lending, Jacob will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase his farm’s productivity and improve his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm tools and certified seeds for planting for high production and supply to increase her income.

loans.name: Elimerdah

texts.en:
Elimeldah is 54 years old, married to Daniel and supports a family of 5 children. She has been in the farm supply business for the last 17 years earning KES 8,000 per month.

Elimeldah has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy additional stock of fresh vegetables like tomatoes, onions and cabbages. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fresh vegetables like tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru: Эту скромную и простую женщину зовут Ханифа. Она жительница района Турсунзаде. Её муж и сыновья работают строителями. Сама Ханифа занимается шитьем. Она имеет 6 лет опыт работы в этой сфере. Она зарабатывает больше, чем её муж и сыновья. Ханифа тратит все свои деньги на корм своей семьи. Уже 5-ый год как они не смогут отремонтировать свой дом, так как у них не хватает денег. В этом году Ханифа решила обратиться за кредитом. Она очень верит в Вашу поддержу и обещает, что во время будет погашать свой кредит.
texts.en: The name of this modest and simple woman is Hanifa. She is a resident of the Tursun-zoda district. Her husband and sons are construction workers. Hanifa is involved in sewing. She has 6 years of experience in this field. She earns more than her husband and sons. Hanifa spends all of her money on feeding her family. They have not been able to repair their house for 5 years because they did not have enough money. This year, Hanifa decided to request a loan. She really believes in Your support and promises to repay the loan on-time.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of shoes to sell to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 29 years old, married to Mary and supports a family of two children.

He has been practicing farming for the last seven years earning KES 8,000 per month.

Richard has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a wheelbarrow for transporting farm produce to the market to sell for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy a vehicle for transport.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow for transporting farm produce to the market to sell for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of potatoes to sell to clients and meet their demands.

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Абдукарим 37 лет. Он семейный человек, и из района Руми. Абдукарим 6 лет своей жизни продвигает животноводческой деятельностью. У него есть коровник, где он выращивает крупнорогатого скота. На фотке снято Абдукарим и его коровник и скот. Он любить домашних животных как своих детей. Ему нравится домашние животные, и он выбрал эту деятельность, чтобы с удовольствием заниматься животноводством. Абдукарим сильный, серьезный и заботливый человек. Он недавно сломал свою руку, и он не смотря на сломанную руку, продвигает бизнес вперед. Абдукарим хочет купить несколько крупнорогатого скота, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота и расширить деятельность. По этой причине он решил обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Abdukarim is 37 years old. He is a family man from the Rumy district. Abdukarim has been running an animal husbandry business for 6 years of his life. He has a cowshed, where he fattens up cattle. The picture shows Abdukarim, his cowshed and livestock. He loves his livestock like he loves his children. He likes domestic animals and chose this business to enjoy animal husbandry. Abdukarim is a strong, serious and caring person. He recently broke his arm and, despite the broken arm, still works on advancing his business. Abdukarim wants to buy cattle in order to increase his livestock headcount and expand his business. This is why he decided to request a loan.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to increase his livestock headcount and expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize grains to sell to clients and meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Melvil Eliseo

texts.es: Don Melvin de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica  al cultivo de frijol y maíz posee 35 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su casa, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumo fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y asi tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en: Melvin is 51 year old and lives in his own house with his wife and son. He grows beans and corn and has 35 years of experience being a farmer. He sells his products in the different markets which are close to his house. He is asking for a loan to buy fertiliser, manure, plague control, herbicide, etc.This will help him improve his income.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, plague control, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past six years, Zam has been working hard to manage her rental house business.

To help expand her business, Zam has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more building materials that will be used to renovate the rental houses. This will help Zam to generate greater profits and complete the rental houses in time for tenants to begin to rent her houses. Zam hopes that in the future, she will be able to own 60 more rental rooms by 2018.

Zam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Zam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more building materials that will be used to renovate her rental house.

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es:
La venta de plátanos, es la actividad en la cual se desempeña Henry, un hombre con empuje y perseverancia para sacar adelante su propio negocio y a su familia.
El se dedica a esta actividad desde hace pocos días trabajando desde muy temprano en la mañana todos los días para ofrecer sus alimentos.
Trabaja con un empleado todos los días durante 8 horas.

Decidió iniciar este proyecto al ver la necesidad de obtener más ingresos para su familia y ya que no tenía la educación suficiente para otro cargo, opto por la venta de estos alimentos.

Es un hombre simpático y servicial, siempre dispuesto a atender las inquietudes y deseos de sus clientes.

El pide un auxilio económico con la Corporación Interactuar para comprar una motocicleta con góndola para poder transportar sus plátanos.

Su sueño es tener un local en cual pueda vender tranquilo y cómodamente sus alimentos.

Presta y aporta hoy, anímate!
texts.en:
Henry sells bananas. He is a driven man who perseveres in order to move his business forward along with his family.

He has only being doing this job for a few days. He works from very early in the morning every day, offering his food products.

He works with an employee every day for 8 hours.

He decided to start this project upon realising that he needed to obtain a better income for his family and as he did not have a good enough education for other jobs, he opted to sell bananas. 

He is a kind and helpful man who is always ready to attend to the concerns and desires of his clients.  

He is asking for economic support from Corporación Interactuar to buy a motorcycle with a sidecar in order to transport bananas. His dream is to own a small shop from which he can sell his food products with greater ease. 

Lend and support today, go for it!

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle with a sidecar in order to transport bananas.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is a widow and has four children. For the past four years, Rehema has been working hard to manage her rental house business, where she manages and rents her rental houses.

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 4,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials that will be used to renovate the rental houses, and will help Rehema to generate greater profits because the rental houses will be more attractive to her tenants. Rehema hopes that in the future, she will be able to build more rental houses on the remaining land.

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more materials to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Nighty

texts.en:
Nighty is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Nighty has been working hard to manage her retail shop that sells household items like sugar, water and rice.

To help expand her business, Nighty has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy enough commodities like rice and cooking oil to sell and will help Nighty to generate greater profits and have enough stock to attract more customers to her business. Nighty hopes that in the future, she will be able to open another shop.

Nighty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nighty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy enough commodities like rice and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kinoni in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Frank has been working hard to manage his bar business, which sells soft drinks and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Frank has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of beer, soda and chairs for the business which will attract more customers. This will help Frank generate greater profits and improve more in his business so he can have enough profits. Frank hopes that in the future he will be able to have his kids study in better schools. 

Frank is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Frank who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of beer, soda and chairs for the business which will attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy belts, discs and blades amongst other tools

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Micheal has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells timber.

To help expand his business, Micheal has requested a loan of 3000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add more timber to increase his stock, and it will help Micheal generate greater profits and pay the school fees for his young kids. Micheal hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his profits and own another business of the same kind to create more jobs in the community. 

Micheal is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Micheal who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add more timber to increase his stock.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and also grows crops. She describes her challenge as a lack of enough facilities for water storage. She will use the 24,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George has a one-acre farm in the Kitale area of Kenya, where he lives with his family. He has dairy cows, poultry, and a tree garden consisting of 200 trees. He sells his produce at a local market near his home where the demand for his products are high but the prices are low. George started farming eight years ago, and, through the years, he has had no difficulty in satisfying his customers’ needs.

A big problem that smallholder farmers like George are facing is lack of access to financial products and services. George wants to buy agricultural inputs, but there are no banks where he lives. It has been very difficult for him to obtain the capital to buy improved seeds, fertilizers, and other important inputs that control weeds and pests until now.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, George is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy farm inputs. With your lending, George will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase the quality and quantity of yields from his farm. Income from this investment will be used to pay loan debt and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy important farm inputs that will increase the quality and quantity of yields from his farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea, and she describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of enough water.

She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy iron sheets for roofing her house. This will also enable her to harvest rainwater. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy iron sheets for roofing her house.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she grows crops, and she describes her challenge to be a lack of enough water.

She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Geofrey is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nyendo in the Masaka region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past four years, Geofrey has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which is in the business of selling household items like sugar and rice.

To help expand his business, Geofrey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items for the store to increase his sales, and it will help Geofrey generate greater profits, take good care of his family, and provide enough basic needs for his family. Geofrey hopes that in the future he will be able to own another retail shop in the same town center. 

Geofrey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Geofrey, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more items for the store to increase his sales.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past five years, Carol has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sells second-hand clothes. 

To help expand her business, Carol has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to have a stock of new fashion clothes that will attract more customers and increase her sales. The loan will help Carol generate greater profits and increase her daily sales, hence improving her profits. Carol hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger shop which sells both men's and ladies' shoes. 

Carol is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Carol, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: have a stock of new fashion clothes that will attract more customers and increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts such as wind screens, rims, shock absorbers and springs and hopes this will enable him to serve more customers and make more income.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a farm where she keeps cows, and she describes her challenge as a lack of enough water.

She will use the 25,000 KES loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 20-year-old young woman currently living in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at her local secondary school, where she teaches life skills sessions.

She has repaid her $500 loan well, and she is running a successful poultry project. Using the profits she is getting from her business, she is paying her fees to supplement her "O" level subjects. She hopes to get another Kiva loan so that she can further extend her poultry business.

loans.use: purchase more chickens and drugs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Fredi Francisco

texts.es: Fredi de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su padre, el se dedica al cultivo de frijol y maíz desde hace 20 años y gracias a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, fredi está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredi, 32, lives in his own home with his wife and father.  For 20 years he has been growing beans and corn, thanks to which he has been able to support his family.  He sells his produce near where he lives.

Fredi is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, etc. to improve the land seen in the photograph so he can continue his work and improve his income.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest control agents, etc. to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of cereal to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wire, plant bags, fertilizer, etc. to increase crop production.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol desde hace 15 años y también trabaja como jornal, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
This young woman's face is blurred because she is 29 and lives in a high risk area.  She has worked in agriculture for 15 years, growing corn and beans.  She also works as a day laborer.  At harvest time she sells her produce in neighboring villages where she has many steady customers.  She lives in her own house with her husband and son.

The loan she is requesting is to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control agents, herbicides, etc., and to improve the land seen in the photograph.  This is so she can continue her crop activity which is her only source of income, in an aim to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control agents, etc., and to improve her land.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Miguel de 27 años de edad quien habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad. Él es una persona  responsable y que con mucha dedicación ha podido sacar adelante a su familia. Las personas que conocen a Miguel lo recomiendan por ser una hombre amable, él trabaja cultivando plátanos pero desea  trabajar otra parte de su tierra  y poder incrementar sus ingresos y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: semillas, abono, pago de tractor para arar la tierra,  etc., para cultivar la otra parte de su terreno.
texts.en:
Miguel, 27, lives in his own house with his life partner and three-year-old daughter.  He is a responsible person who has dedicated much of his life to providing for his family.  People who know Miguel recommend him as a kind person.  He grows bananas but wants to plant another part of his land to increase his income and give his family a better quality of life.

Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy seeds and manure, and to rent a tractor to plow the land in another area of his cropland.

loans.use: To buy seeds and manure, and to rent a tractor to plow the land in another area of his cropland.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 33 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frijol tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la actividad agrícola y también trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casacón lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra salir adelanté, el quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando puertas y ventas pero como no posee de suficiente capital está solicitando un crédito para la compra de las puertas, ventanas y pago de mano de obra para que el y su esposa puedan vivir seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Daniel, 33, lives in his own house with his wife.  For 15 years he has been working in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He also works as a day laborer on a farm near his home, and with his earnings he is able to get ahead.

He would like to remodel his house with doors and windows but does not have enough capital.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy doors and windows, and to hire workers so he and his wife and live in a safer, more comfortable environment.

loans.use: To buy doors and windows, and to hire workers.

loans.name: Subhiniso

texts.ru: Субхинисо жительница района Чиликул. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем и пока у нее нет детей.  Ее муж работает строителем в Российской Федерации, он каждый месяц отправляет деньги домой. Субхинисо рукодельница, он 10 лет занимается, шьет национальную женскую одежду у себя дома. Субхинисо проживает с отцом и матерью. Она хочет купить желаемую швейную машинку и ткани, чтоб улучшить процесс своей работы. У нее нет денег, для купли желаемую швейную машинку, и она обратилась за кредитом. Вы можете поддержать ее сейчас!
texts.en: Subhiniso is a resident of the Jilikul district of Tajikistan.  She is 25 and married, but she doesn't have any children yet.  Her husband works in construction in the Russian Federation.  He sends money home every month.  Subhiniso is a seamstress.  She has been sewing traditional women's dresses from home for the past ten years.  She lives with her father and mother.  She wants to buy a much needed sewing machine and some fabrics in order to improve her work conditions.  However, she has no money for this purchase, which is the reason why she's taking a loan.  Please support her today!

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, beams and nails to change the roof of her kitchen

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.ru: Это мужчина Дилшод. Ему 40 лет. Он из района Руми. Дилшод женат и отец троих детей. Он в районе занимается резчиком у себя дома. Его жена работает медсестрой в больнице. Дети учатся в средней школе. Дилшод талантливый и добрый человек. 9 лет он занят резчиком. Дилшод производит сундук, он занимается один. Он хорошо справляется своим работой, у него имеется много клиентов. Через месяц начинается сезон свадьбы, и уже каждый день клиенты возрастают. Дилшод хочет приобрести инструменты для работы, чтобы улучшить и ускорить процесс работы. И он решил обратиться за кредитом.
texts.en: Meet Dilshod, a 40-year-old man from the Rumi district of Tajikistan.  Dilshod is married and the father of three children.  He is a wood carver and he works from home.  His wife works as a nurse in a hospital.  Their children attend secondary school.  Dilshod is both skilled and kind.  He has been involved in this field of work for the past nine years.  Dilshod works alone and does an excellent job; he makes chests and has many customers.  The wedding season starts in a month and he is currently getting new customers every day.  Dilshod wants to purchase some tools which will improve and speed up his work process.  For this reason, he has decided to apply for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools which will improve and speed up his work process.

loans.name: Shahnozai

texts.ru: 22 летняя молодая дехканка Шахнозаи. Она родилась и выросла в районе Руми. Шахнозаи замужем и мать одного прекрасного ребенка. Муж дехканин. Он занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельностью. 3 года Шахнозаи занимается животноводством и растениеводством. Но животноводческая деятельность является основной, потому что Шахнозаи много времени проводит на скотном рынке, и доход от этой деятельность обеспечить ее семью. 3 года назад Шахнозаи научил ее муж заниматься животноводством. Она сейчас выращивает мелко рогатого скота у себя во дворе. Шахнозаи собирается расширить животноводческую деятельность путем увеличения поголовья скота. С такими планами он она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
This 22 years old dekhan farmer is Shahnozai. She was born and raised in the J.Rumy region. Shahnozai is married and the mother of a beautiful child. Her husband is a dekhan farmer too. He works with field crop cultivation. 

Shahnozai has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation for three years. The livestock breeding is her main business, because she spends a lot of time at the livestock market, and the income from this business provides for her family.

Shahnozai learned to work with livestock three years ago, from her husband. She currently raises sheep and goats in her yard. Shahnozai decided to expand her livestock breeding business through increasing the number of livestock. She applied for a loan with this plan in mind.

loans.use: to expand her livestock breeding business through purchasing sheep and goats

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Señor de los Milagros” y está conformado por 05 socias comprometidas y responsables. Cristina de 50 años de edad es conviviente con 6 hijos uno de ellos dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace más de 5 años. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mejorar su negocio y le va bien, se siente feliz porque gracias al préstamo mejora cada día más su calidad de vida. Su último crédito lo destinará para la compra de chupetines caramelos, galletas y gaseosas. El grupo “señor de los milagros” agradece a las personas de kiva por hacer posible éste crédito. Cristina se encuentra de pie en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste chompa color rosado.
texts.en:
This is the “Señor de los Milagros” (Lord of Miracles) group and it is made up of 5 committed and responsible members. 

Cristina is 50 years old and she has a partner and 6 children, one of whom is dependent. She has made a living selling sweets for more than 5 years. Through a lot of effort she has managed to develop her business and it is going well. She is happy because the loan has helped her improve her life day by day. She will use her latest loan to purchase lollipops, biscuits and soft drinks. 

The “Señor de los Milagros” group would like to thank the people of Kiva for making this loan possible. Cristina is standing at the back of the photo, she is the second from the right and is wearing a pink jumper.

loans.use: to purchase lollipops, biscuits and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mario Eden

texts.es: Mario de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el se dedica desde hace 15 años a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijol, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños, ya tiene muchos clientes fijos, Mario está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: 42 year old Mario lives in his own home with his wife and son. For the last 15 years he has worked in agriculture to cultivate maize and beans. When he harvests it he sells his products in the neighboring towns, and he already has many regular customers. Mario is seeking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and to improve the land which is shown in the photo to be able to continue his cultivation and get a better income, as this is his only source of employment.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. and to improve his land

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 55 year old married mother of six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development. 

She practices mixed farming and is taking a Kiva loan to buy indigenous chickens to add stock to her poultry farming business. This will increase her income and enable her pay school fees for her children.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy indigenous chickens.

loans.name: Ema Paulina

texts.es:
Ema es una mujer de 30 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena madre, paciente, independiente, emprendedora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio o desarrolla en la zona ‘16 de julio’ área central situada al este de la ciudad, reúne a gran parte de los edificios administrativos, comerciales y sedes de organizaciones sociales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Ema es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de sus hijos que empiezan la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano de mujer, como; chaquetas, abrigos, chompas, blusas, camisas, chamarras, etc., actividad que realiza en su puesto de venta fijo al aire libre, en horas del día 6 días a la semana, su forma de negocio es la ropa de temporada, “inicié mi actividad desde muy joven, con la ayuda de mis padres logré adquirir un puesto fijo de venta el cual es la única fuente de ingresos de mi familia…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es tener un puesto de venta bajo techo, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano temporada de invierno por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Ema solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de dama de segunda mano por mayor y con los beneficios techar su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Ema is a 30 year old woman.  She is single and has two children ages 5 and 6.  Her business involves selling second-hand clothing.  She is a good mother, patient, independent, hard-working, responsible and very dedicated.
